original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Thus” means in that way.

original: ri bong gi rva de 'jim gong la yod pa des na 'jim gong 'di ri bong gi rva de'i rgyu nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva de 'jim gong la yod pa des na 'jim gong 'di ri bong gi rva de'i rgyu nyid du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Since the rabbit’s horns exist in the lump of clay, the lump of clay is apprehended as the cause of those rabbit’s horns.

original: gang gi phyir ri bong gi rva 'jim gor la yod pa des na de don du gnyer bas de rgyu nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ri bong gi rva 'jim gor la yod pa des na de don du gnyer bas de rgyu nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the rabbit’s horns exist in the lump of clay, those who seek them apprehend the lump of clay as their cause.

original: der skyed ces bya ba ni rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: der skyed ces bya ba ni rtsod pa ste /
translated: “It generates that” is the objection.

original: 'jim gong der skye ba ba de dang bral ba ma yin pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de med pa'i phyir 'jim gong la ri bong gi rva med par grangs can 'dod na'o //
analyzed: 'jim gong der skye ba ba de dang bral ba ma yin pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa de med pa'i phyir 'jim gong la ri bong gi rva med par grangs can 'dod na'o //
translated: Since the lump of clay is not devoid of the generation of that, the nonexistence of the rabbit’s horns, etc., the Sāṃkhya assert that the rabbit’s horns do not exist in the lump of clay.

original: don ni 'di yin gal te yang 'jim gong la bum pa yod pa de lta yang 'jim gong la skye ba'i khyad par can gyi ri bong gi rva ni med de /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin gal te yang 'jim gong la bum pa yod pa de lta yang 'jim gong la skye ba'i khyad par can gyi ri bong gi rva ni med de /
translated: The meaning is this. Even though the pot exists in the lump of clay, the rabbit’s horns, which are qualified by generation from the lump of clay, do not exist in the lump of clay.

original: 'jim gong la ni skyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jim gong la ni skyed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the lump of clay does not have the ability to generate them.

original: de skyed pa'i zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “It generates that” is the response.

original: yod pa tsam nyid las de skyed pa'i nus pa nyid rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa tsam nyid las de skyed pa'i nus pa nyid rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the pot.🔽The mere existence of the clay

original: yod pa tsam du ni 'jim gong la ri bong gi rva @97b khyod kyis khas blangs te /
analyzed: yod pa tsam du ni 'jim gong la ri bong gi rva @97b khyod kyis khas blangs te /
translated: would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the pot.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay

original: des na de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis kyang de skyed pa'i nus par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis kyang de skyed pa'i nus par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: would be the cause of the pot.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay

original: des na 'jim gong yang ri bong gis bskyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'jim gong yang ri bong gis bskyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: would be the cause of the pot.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay

original: ci ltar na yod pa nyid de skyed pa'i nus ba go bar byed pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar na yod pa nyid de skyed pa'i nus ba go bar byed pa yin snyam na /
translated: would be the cause of the pot.

original: 'di gnyis kyi khyab pa ston pa ni /🔽de lta mi nan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi khyab pa ston pa ni / de lta mi nan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the pot.🔽The mere existence of the clay

original: 'jim gong la ri bong gi rva yod pa yin yang gal te de skyed pa'i nus pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jim gong la ri bong gi rva yod pa yin yang gal te de skyed pa'i nus pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the pot.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the pot.🔽The mere existence of the clay

original: de'i tshe 'jim gong de la de skyed pa'i nus pa med pa nyid rtogs pas ri bong gi rva de yod par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jim gong de la de skyed pa'i nus pa med pa nyid rtogs pas ri bong gi rva de yod par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the pot.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.🔽The mere existence of the clay

original: de skyed pa'i nus pas ni yod pa nyid la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: de skyed pa'i nus pas ni yod pa nyid la khyab pa yin te /
translated: would be the cause of the pot.🔽The mere existence of the clay🔽would be the cause of the rabbit’s horns.

original: de med na de yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na de yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, it would not exist.

original: skabs kyis ni yod pa nyid du khas blangs te /
analyzed: skabs kyis ni yod pa nyid du khas blangs te /
translated: In some contexts, it is accepted that it exists.

original: de lta ma yin na 'jim gong la bum pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'jim gong la bum pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, a pot would exist in a lump of clay.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni grangs can pa ri bong gi rva las bum pa'i byad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni grangs can pa ri bong gi rva las bum pa'i byad par ston pa'o //
translated: If, on the other hand, means that the Sāṃkhya teaches that a pot is the form of a rabbit’s horns.

original: rgyu gang las 'bras bu bum pa la sogs pa gang skyes pa'i rgyu de la 'bras bu de yod do zhes rtogs kyi ri bong gi rva ni de lta ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang las 'bras bu bum pa la sogs pa gang skyes pa'i rgyu de la 'bras bu de yod do zhes rtogs kyi ri bong gi rva ni de lta ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: The thought is that a cause from which an effect such as a pot is produced is understood to be the existence of that effect, but a rabbit’s horns are not like that.

original: skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: skyes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The response begins with if it is produced.

original: rtags skyes pas bum pa yod pa nyid du rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: rtags skyes pas bum pa yod pa nyid du rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If the existence of a pot is understood through the arising of a sign,

original: skyes pa'i sngon rol 'jim gong gi gnas skabs na ni bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa med de des na 'brel pa ma shes pa'i rtags las yod par ci ltar rtogs /
analyzed: skyes pa'i sngon rol 'jim gong gi gnas skabs na ni bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu shes pa med de des na 'brel pa ma shes pa'i rtags las yod par ci ltar rtogs /
translated: then prior to arising, when the state of a lump of clay exists, the effect such as a pot is not known. Therefore, how could its existence be understood from a sign whose relation is not known?

original: sngon rol te 'jim pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: sngon rol te 'jim pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Prior to arising, when the state of clay exists,

original: yod par shes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yod par shes pa med pa'o //
translated: The effect is not known to exist.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rtags su gyur pa'i skye ba las de zhes bya ba 'bras bu yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rtags su gyur pa'i skye ba las de zhes bya ba 'bras bu yod pa nyid do //
translated: “From that” means from the arising that is the reason. “That” is the effect, which is known to exist.

original: ci ste mi rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste mi rtogs snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is not understood,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “In that case,”

original: gang gi phyir de ltar zhes bya ba ma shes pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang skye ba 'brel ba rab tu grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar zhes bya ba ma shes pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang skye ba 'brel ba rab tu grub pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not understood in that way, the effect that is known to exist and the arising are not established as related.

original: gal te rgyu las ci lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu yod pa las kyang 'bras bu'i pa 'grub ba nyid ma yin nam zhes rtsod pa /
analyzed: gal te rgyu las ci lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu yod pa las kyang 'bras bu'i pa 'grub ba nyid ma yin nam zhes rtsod pa /
translated: If the effect exists in accordance with the cause, then is it not the case that the effect is established from the effect that exists?

original: grangs can gyi lugs kyis smras pa ni /
analyzed: grangs can gyi lugs kyis smras pa ni /
translated: The Sāṃkhya system is stated:

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Just as” is said.

original: de yod las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'jim gong la yod pa las kyang /
analyzed: de yod las kyang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'jim gong la yod pa las kyang /
translated: “From that which exists” means from the effect that exists in the lump of clay.

original: 'bras bu de 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu de 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “That effect will arise.”

original: 'di la lan ni 'bras gang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan ni 'bras gang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is “What effect?”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi yod pa nyid gang yin pa de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi yod pa nyid gang yin pa de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de /
translated: The existence of the cause and the effect is the antecedent of the effect.

original: ci ltar 'bras bu yod pa de nyid yin par @98a * //
analyzed: ci ltar 'bras bu yod pa de nyid yin par @98a * //
translated: How could that which is the existence of the effect be the existence of the cause?

original: 'gyur te rgyu'i yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gyur te rgyu'i yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: it would be the cause.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'bras gang gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras gang gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is: whatever effect.

original: des na 'bras bu ma nges pas ni rang gi yod pa bsgrub par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu ma nges pas ni rang gi yod pa bsgrub par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, since the effect is not ascertained, it cannot establish its own existence.

original: grangs can gyi bsam pa nyid kyis ma nges pa'i lan rgol bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: grangs can gyi bsam pa nyid kyis ma nges pa'i lan rgol bar byed pa ni /
translated: The Sāṃkhya responds to the objection of nonascertainment with his own intention:

original: gzhan bzhin zhes bya ba nas nus 'byung 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: gzhan bzhin zhes bya ba nas nus 'byung 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: Like the other, up to it would arise from potential.

original: zhe na'i sgra ni 'gyur gyi sgra'i 'og tu spo bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhe na'i sgra ni 'gyur gyi sgra'i 'og tu spo bar bya'o //
translated: The word “if” should be supplied from below the word “is.”

original: nus las zhes bya ba ni 'jim gong gi nus pa las so //
analyzed: nus las zhes bya ba ni 'jim gong gi nus pa las so //
translated: From potential means from the potential of the lump of clay.

original: 'bras bu mngon par mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid de las 'bras bu thams cad 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon par mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid de las 'bras bu thams cad 'byung ba yin no //
translated: All effects arise from that which has the characteristic of the nonmanifestation of the effect.

original: gang gi nus pa dang 'dra bar zhe na gzhan bzhin zhes smos te /
analyzed: gang gi nus pa dang 'dra bar zhe na gzhan bzhin zhes smos te /
translated: What is similar to its potency? He says, “like another.”

original: dper na 'jim gong las gzhan rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'jim gong las gzhan rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the potency of a potter, etc., which is different from the lump of clay.

original: de lta na yang ci ltar gcig tu nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci ltar gcig tu nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: Even so, how is it ascertained as one?

original: nus pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From the potency itself.

original: mngon par mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi nus pa nyid las nus pa zhes bya ba mngon par gsal ba'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi nus pa nyid las nus pa zhes bya ba mngon par gsal ba'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the potency itself, which has the characteristic of nonmanifestation, the effect, which is called manifestation, arises. This is the meaning.

original: lan ni tha dad med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni tha dad med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, “If there is no difference.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i nus pa dag tha mi dad par gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i nus pa dag tha mi dad par gyur pa yin na /
translated: If the potency that is the cause and the potency that is the effect are not different,

original: ci ltar nus pa las nus pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: ci ltar nus pa las nus pa 'byung ste /
translated: how could the potency arise from the potency?

original: rang nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is, “If there is no difference, how could the potency arise from the potency?”

original: gal te nus pa las mngon par gsal bskyed na'o //
analyzed: gal te nus pa las mngon par gsal bskyed na'o //
translated: If manifestation is generated from the potency,

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang nyid la byed pa 'gal ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang nyid la byed pa 'gal ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is not contradictory for something to act on itself.

original: lan ni nus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni nus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is: “If it is possible.”

original: gal te nus pa las gsal ba skye na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa las gsal ba skye na /
translated: If manifestation arises from potency,

original: de'i tshe gsal ba de ci nus pa las gzhan yin par khas len nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe gsal ba de ci nus pa las gzhan yin par khas len nam /
translated: then at that time, do you accept that manifestation is different from potency?

original: de lta'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that is so,

original: de'i tshe rgyu'i bdag nyid la gsal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyu'i bdag nyid la gsal ba med do //
translated: then manifestation does not exist in the nature of the cause.

original: de lta yin dang khyod kyi lugs kyis bskyed bya ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyod kyi lugs kyis bskyed bya ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is the case, then according to your system, it is not a product,

original: med pa las skye bar khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa las skye bar khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you do not accept that it arises from what is nonexistent.

original: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid la gsal ba yod na de'i tshe ci ltar bskyed de bskyed par mi 'gyur te skye ba'i don mi 'grig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i bdag nyid la gsal ba yod na de'i tshe ci ltar bskyed de bskyed par mi 'gyur te skye ba'i don mi 'grig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if manifestation exists in the nature of the cause, then how could it be produced? It could not be produced, because the meaning of arising would not be tenable.

original: 'on te gal te phyi'i bum pa gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te phyi'i bum pa gsal ba yin na /
translated: But if you say that if the external vase is manifestation,

original: de'i tshe yod pa de bskyed par bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa de bskyed par bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, what exists would not be produced.

original: 'on kyang gtso bo'i yongs su 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi blo gsal ba yin la de yang bskyed par bya ba kho na'o snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gtso bo'i yongs su 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi blo gsal ba yin la de yang bskyed par bya ba kho na'o snyam na /
translated: But the nature of the transformation of the primal substance is the manifestation of cognition, and that is what is produced.

original: gsal ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “manifestation.”

original: de yang ni blo'o //
analyzed: de yang ni blo'o //
translated: And that is cognition.

original: khyed cag ni 'bras bu yod par smra @98b ba yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu mtha' dag yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: khyed cag ni 'bras bu yod par smra @98b ba yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu mtha' dag yin pa kho na'o //
translated: You are the Sāṃkhyas, because you maintain that the effect exists.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means “because it exists.”

original: de ni blo'o //
analyzed: de ni blo'o //
translated: That is the intellect.

original: ming yin na zhes bya ba ni bdag yin na'o //
analyzed: ming yin na zhes bya ba ni bdag yin na'o //
translated: If it is the name, that is, if it is the self,

original: rtag pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i bdag de ci ltar skye /
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i bdag de ci ltar skye /
translated: how can that self, which is not produced because it is eternal, be produced?

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba bskyed bya ma yin pas na rang gi rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu tshad ma dang ldan pa de ni gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba bskyed bya ma yin pas na rang gi rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu tshad ma dang ldan pa de ni gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: “Therefore” means “because the manifestation is not produced, the effect of its own causes, which is not the manifestation, is not valid.”

original: gal te yod pa mngon par mi gsal ba nyid mngon par gsal ba gzhan gyis kyang khas blang bar bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yod pa mngon par mi gsal ba nyid mngon par gsal ba gzhan gyis kyang khas blang bar bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not manifest because it exists, is it not to be accepted as manifest by another?

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it is not so,

original: mun khung na bum pa med pa'i phyir ci zhig mngon par gsal snyam na /
analyzed: mun khung na bum pa med pa'i phyir ci zhig mngon par gsal snyam na /
translated: what is manifest in a dark room, since a pot does not exist there?

original: mun pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mun pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called “darkness.”

original: rig pa ni shes pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa ni shes pa ste /
translated: “Knowledge” is cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa'am rtags kyi rigs kyis rig pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'am rtags kyi rigs kyis rig pa yin no //
translated: It is knowledge by inference or by the method of signs.

original: mun khung na ni bum pa yod do zhes reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa nye bar bstan pa'i reg pa /
analyzed: mun khung na ni bum pa yod do zhes reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa nye bar bstan pa'i reg pa /
translated: In a dark house, one says, a pot exists.🔽

original: gzugs la mi 'khrul ba'i rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la mi 'khrul ba'i rtogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In a dark room, one can point out the existence of a pot by saying, “The pot is here,” because there is a cognition that arises from the sense of touch and is not mistaken with regard to form.

original: gal te ci ltar mun khung na gnas pa'i bum pa rjes su dpag par bya ba de bzhin du 'jim gong la yang mngon par mi gsal ba'i bum pa yod par rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin nam snyam na /🔽bum sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te ci ltar mun khung na gnas pa'i bum pa rjes su dpag par bya ba de bzhin du 'jim gong la yang mngon par mi gsal ba'i bum pa yod par rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin nam snyam na / bum sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that, just as a pot in a dark room is to be inferred, so too a pot that is not manifest in a lump of clay is to be inferred, then you should consider this.

original: bum pa la sogs pa mngon par mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa mngon par mi gsal ba'o //
translated: A pot, etc., is not manifest.

original: gang gi phyir gsal bar mi rigs pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsal bar mi rigs pa des na /
translated: Because it is not reasonable that it be manifest,🔽it is not reasonable that it be unmanifest.

original: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba ston pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba ston pa ste /
translated: Everything is impermanent. This is the statement of an inference.

original: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: gang byas pa de ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Whatever is produced is impermanent,

original: dper na gsal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gsal ba bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, for example.

original: bum pa yang byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa yang byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And a pot is produced.

original: des na ni mi rtag pas na'o //
analyzed: des na ni mi rtag pas na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is impermanent.

original: de ltar phyogs kyi gnod pa rnam pa bzhi bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs kyi gnod pa rnam pa bzhi bshad nas /
translated: Having thus explained the four types of internal contradiction,

original: rang gi chos can la zhes slob dpon gyi thugs la gnas pa la brtsad pa brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi chos can la zhes slob dpon gyi thugs la gnas pa la brtsad pa brjod pa ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the master states the objection that resides in his own mind, “Well then, . . .”

original: ci ltar don med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar don med snyam na /
translated: How is it meaningless?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ In this way . . .”

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning:

original: gang zhig tshad mas gnod ba de ni phyogs ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig bstan bar bya ba yin gyi /🔽tshad mas gnod pa ni rang gi chos can nam /
analyzed: gang zhig tshad mas gnod ba de ni phyogs ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig bstan bar bya ba yin gyi / tshad mas gnod pa ni rang gi chos can nam /
translated: “One should teach only this much: ‘That which is contradicted by a valid cognition is not a position.’

original: rang gi chos can las gzhan la zhes bya ba 'di ni gang du nye bar mkho ste /
analyzed: rang gi chos can las gzhan la zhes bya ba 'di ni gang du nye bar mkho ste /
translated: Where is it necessary to specify that the contradiction is with respect to one’s own subject or with respect to something other than one’s own subject?

original: gnod do cog thams cad ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod do cog thams cad ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all contradictions are like the case of a position.”

original: des na rang gi chos can zhes khyad par nye bar bzung ba ni don med de rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi chos can zhes khyad par nye bar bzung ba ni don med de rnam par gcad par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the specification “with respect to one’s own subject” is meaningless because there is nothing to be excluded.

original: de 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos @99a * //
analyzed: de 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos @99a * //
translated: “That would be so” means that it would be established as having impermanence.

original: can la'o // gzhan la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par can la'o //
analyzed: can la'o // gzhan la zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par can la'o //
translated: “In another” means in a subject that has the special quality of space.

original: de ltar rang gi chos can smos pa la rgol ba bkod nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi chos can smos pa la rgol ba bkod nas /
translated: Having thus stated the subject in the proof,

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod ba mi rtag pa nyid chos dang ldan pa la gnod na phyogs kyi nyes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod ba mi rtag pa nyid chos dang ldan pa la gnod na phyogs kyi nyes pa yin gyi /
translated: if there is an objection that the probandum, impermanence, is not a property of the subject, that is a fault of the position.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i chos can la ni gnod kyang phyogs kyi nyes pa ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni /🔽kun du zhes bya ba'o //🔽kun du zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i chos can la ni gnod kyang phyogs kyi nyes pa ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni / kun du zhes bya ba'o // kun du zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: But if there is an objection to the subject that has the special quality of space, that is not a fault of the position.🔽The response to that is “everywhere.”🔽The explanation of “everywhere” is:

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba nas yod pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba nas yod pa nyid yin pas zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: “everywhere” up to “because of existing.”

original: rang dang gzhan sangs rgyas pa dang bye brag tu smra ba'i 'dod pas nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par can gyi chos can dang de dang bral ba thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos de yod pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan sangs rgyas pa dang bye brag tu smra ba'i 'dod pas nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par can gyi chos can dang de dang bral ba thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos de yod pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The subject, which is qualified by the property of space, and all that is devoid of that are the existence of the property of impermanence, according to the belief of the Vaibhāṣikas and the Sautrāntikas.

original: gnod pa yin na zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: gnod pa yin na zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la'o //
translated: “If there is a fault” refers to the probandum.

original: skyon du zhes bya ba ni phyogs la gnod pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
analyzed: skyon du zhes bya ba ni phyogs la gnod pa'i mtshan nyid du'o //
translated: “Fault” refers to the characteristic of the fault of the position.

original: gnod pas ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i chos la gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston ba'i don du rang gi chos can smos so zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnod pas ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i chos la gnod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston ba'i don du rang gi chos can smos so zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The subject is mentioned in order to show that the fault does not harm the property to be established.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te don 'di ltar ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te don 'di ltar ma yin na /
translated: “Otherwise” means if this is not the meaning.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i chos can gzhan la gnod kyang bsgrub par 'dod pa 'di la gnod pa ci zhig yod de ci yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i chos can gzhan la gnod kyang bsgrub par 'dod pa 'di la gnod pa ci zhig yod de ci yang med pa nyid do //
translated: If the subject is qualified by the property of space, what harm is there in establishing this, even if there is harm to another subject? There is no harm at all.

original: 'o na ci ltar gnod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar gnod snyam na /
translated: Well then, how is there harm?

original: 'di la zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba'o//
translated: “In this case” is the answer.

original: chos de dang de zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: chos de dang de zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa nyid la'o //
translated: “That property” refers to the property to be established.

original: gnod na zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i chos la'o //
analyzed: gnod na zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i chos la'o //
translated: “If it is damaged” refers to the property to be established.

original: gal te don 'di mtshan nyid kyis don go ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don 'di mtshan nyid kyis don go ba ma yin nam /
translated: “Isn’t the meaning of this understood through the definition?”

original: des na 'di'i don du rang gi chos can smos pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di'i don du rang gi chos can smos pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: “So what is the point of mentioning the subject?”

original: don 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “This meaning” is the answer.

original: ci ltar chos can la gnod pas 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la gnod snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar chos can la gnod pas 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la gnod snyam na /
translated: “How can the subject be damaged if the property to be established is damaged?”

original: rten ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The basis” is the answer.

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar gyis ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar gyis ni /
translated: “Its own nature” is the answer.

original: don 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa bkral ba yin no //
analyzed: don 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa bkral ba yin no //
translated: This explains “this meaning” and so forth.

original: rang gi chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par 'dod pa'i chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Endowed with its own property” means endowed with the property to be established.

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni rang gi chos dang ldan pa'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba yin dang ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni rang gi chos dang ldan pa'i chos can bsgrub par bya ba yin dang ngo //
translated: “If that is the case” means if the subject endowed with its own property is the object to be established.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos dang ldan pa'i chos can dang rjes su mthun pa gnod pa nyid kyi yin gyi /🔽chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i chos can la gnod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba nyid du 'dod pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos dang ldan pa'i chos can dang rjes su mthun pa gnod pa nyid kyi yin gyi / chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i chos can la gnod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: The phrase in accordance with that means that the subject that possesses the property to be established, impermanence, is undermined, but not the subject that possesses some other property.

original: @99b de nyid kyi phyir chos bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos ldan pa'i chos can nyid yin gyi chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i chos can gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @99b de nyid kyi phyir chos bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos ldan pa'i chos can nyid yin gyi chos gzhan dang ldan pa'i chos can gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the property to be established is the subject that possesses the property impermanence, but not the subject that possesses some other property.

original: skyon ni phyogs la gnod par thal ba'i mtshan nyid de //🔽nges par gzung bar rnyed pa'i don nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: skyon ni phyogs la gnod par thal ba'i mtshan nyid de // nges par gzung bar rnyed pa'i don nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The fault is the consequence of undermining the position.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The expression in order to avoid indicates the meaning of the term otherwise.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par can gyi chos can la gnod pas ni nyes par 'gyur srid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan gyi khyad par can gyi chos can la gnod pas ni nyes par 'gyur srid pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for there to be a fault in undermining a subject that possesses the special quality of being a quality of space.

original: des na rang gi chos can smros pas ci bya zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na rang gi chos can smros pas ci bya zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the thought is, What is the use of stating one's own subject?

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos can la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos can la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel ba yin no //
translated: The phrase this is not so and so forth explains the phrase with respect to the subject.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang gi chos can smos pa med pa na /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang gi chos can smos pa med pa na /
translated: The phrase in some other way means without mentioning one's own subject.

original: de gnod ces bya ba ni brjod pa'i chos gnod pa nyid yin gyi chos can gnod pas ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de gnod ces bya ba ni brjod pa'i chos gnod pa nyid yin gyi chos can gnod pas ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase that is impaired means that the stated property is impaired, not that the subject is impaired.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The phrase this also refers to the dispute.

original: bden te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: bden te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The phrase it is true refers to the conclusion.

original: ci ltar 'di'i don gyis 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di'i don gyis 'grub snyam na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase if refers to the meaning of this.

original: rtsa ba'i cha bshad nas grub pa'i mtha' 'chad pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i cha bshad nas grub pa'i mtha' 'chad pa ni 'di ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having explained the root text, the conclusion is stated in the phrase this is.

original: log par rtogs pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: log par rtogs pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is this wrong understanding?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //🔽rgol bas ci zhig brjod pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o // rgol bas ci zhig brjod pa la /
translated: The phrase in this way refers to this.🔽What does the respondent say to the opponent's statement?

original: phyir rgol bas skyon brjod ce na /
analyzed: phyir rgol bas skyon brjod ce na /
translated: The opponent says, What is the fault?

original: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is stated in the phrase for example.

original: bshad pa la zhes bya ba ni rgol bas so //
analyzed: bshad pa la zhes bya ba ni rgol bas so //
translated: The phrase in the explanation refers to the respondent.

original: ci ltar 'di la sun 'byin par byed pa phyir rgol bas smras she na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'di la sun 'byin par byed pa phyir rgol bas smras she na /
translated: How is it that the opponent’s refutation is like that?

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Just so” means just as that.

original: dper na sngon med pa'i rang bzhin bskyed par byar med pa nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: dper na sngon med pa'i rang bzhin bskyed par byar med pa nyid ma yin pa /
translated: For example, it is not that the non-arisen nature is not produced,

original: med par dgag pa'i rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i rang bzhin nyid //
translated: but it is a nature that is an implicative negation.

original: cig car sgra sogs rgyu min phyir //
analyzed: cig car sgra sogs rgyu min phyir //
translated: Because sound and so on are not simultaneous causes.

original: zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa'i chos can dngos po'i ngo bo med par zhes bya bar yang sgrub par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa'i chos can dngos po'i ngo bo med par zhes bya bar yang sgrub par byed do zhe na /
translated: In that way, the proof is by the non-observation of a more extensive property. Just so, with respect to the subject, space and so on, the nature of entities does not exist.

original: 'di la rgol ba sangs rgyas bas len 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la rgol ba sangs rgyas bas len 'debs pa ni /
translated: Here, the opponent, Buddhapalita, raises an objection.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Just so” means just as that.

original: chos can dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa la gnod kyang /
analyzed: chos can dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa la gnod kyang /
translated: Although the nature of the subject, entities, is harmed,

original: 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba sngar med pa'i rang bzhin bskyed par byar med pa nyid dgag pa la ni gnod pa 'ga' yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba sngar med pa'i rang bzhin bskyed par byar med pa nyid dgag pa la ni gnod pa 'ga' yang med pa nyid do //
translated: there is not the slightest harm to the negation of the non-arisen nature being produced, which is the probandum that is asserted.

original: gtan tshigs khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid la gnod pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa nyid la gnod pa yang ma yin no zhes kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: And it should be seen that the reason, the non-apprehension of the pervasion, is not invalidated.

original: chos can la 'ba' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /🔽de ltar 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la //
analyzed: chos can la 'ba' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni / de ltar 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya la //
translated: With respect to only the subject, etc.,🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel ba'o //🔽'di lta bu ni zhes bya pa @100a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel ba'o // 'di lta bu ni zhes bya pa @100a * //
translated: The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.

original: ni chos can 'ba' zhig la gnod pa ni'o //🔽des na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas na'o //🔽gzhi ma grub pa'i nyes pa ci ltar ma yin zhe na /🔽rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni chos can 'ba' zhig la gnod pa ni'o // des na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pas na'o // gzhi ma grub pa'i nyes pa ci ltar ma yin zhe na / rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i'am /🔽bsgrub par bya ba'am /🔽rgol ba'i'o // gang gi phyir dngos por gyur pa chos can ma yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'i'am / bsgrub par bya ba'am / rgol ba'i'o // gang gi phyir dngos por gyur pa chos can ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.

original: chos can de bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba 'ba' zhig la'o //
analyzed: chos can de bsgrub par bya ba dang bral ba 'ba' zhig la'o //
translated: The commentary on only the subject is the probandum is not established.🔽The commentary on only the subject is

original: gnod pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du rang gi chos can smos so //
analyzed: gnod pa'i nyes pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du rang gi chos can smos so //
translated: The subject is mentioned in order to show that there is no fault of contradiction.

original: chos can 'ba' zhig la gnod pas kyang ci'i phyir nyes par mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: chos can 'ba' zhig la gnod pas kyang ci'i phyir nyes par mi 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that there is no fault even if the subject alone is contradicted,

original: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said:🔽If the subject is contradicted, the property is not established.🔽If the subject is contradicted, the property is not established.

original: chos can gzhan ni nam mkha' la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa'i chos can la gnod na sngon med pa'i rang bzhin bskyed par byar med pa yin pa bkag pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos de mi 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can gzhan ni nam mkha' la sogs pa dngos por gyur pa'i chos can la gnod na sngon med pa'i rang bzhin bskyed par byar med pa yin pa bkag pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos de mi 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: If the other subject, such as space, is contradicted, the property that is the nature of the negation, which is not to be produced as a previously non-existent nature, is not unestablished.

original: 'grub pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'grub pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is established, that is the meaning.

original: nyes pa ma yin pa ni chos can 'ba' zhig la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ma yin pa ni chos can 'ba' zhig la gnod pa'o //
translated: The fault is not contradicting the subject alone.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa chos can du nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa chos can du nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown the aspect of conceptualization as the subject,

original: da ni rnam 'grel gnyis pa de nyid rnam par 'grel bas dngos por gyur ba'i chos can ston bar byed pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni rnam 'grel gnyis pa de nyid rnam par 'grel bas dngos por gyur ba'i chos can ston bar byed pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: now, in order to teach the subject that is an existent thing by commenting on the second verse, it says or else.

original: nam mkha' mi rtag pa yin te //
analyzed: nam mkha' mi rtag pa yin te //
translated: Space is impermanent,🔽because it is an object of knowledge,🔽like a pot.

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa'i'o //
translated: This is the Buddhist position.

original: gnod mod ces bya ba la sogs pas ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gnod mod ces bya ba la sogs pas ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “ But it is refuted” and so on is the conclusion.

original: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' rtag pa nyid la gnod kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' rtag pa nyid la gnod kyang ngo //
translated: “ But even so” means that even though the permanence of space is refuted.

original: ci ltar rtag pa chos can ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar rtag pa chos can ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is permanence not a property of the subject?

original: gtan tshigs kyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Because of the reason” and so on.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa ni rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa ni rtag pa nyid do //
translated: The opposite of the probandum is permanence.

original: ci ltar bzlog pa la gnod snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar bzlog pa la gnod snyam na /
translated: How is it refuted?

original: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ The subject” and so on.

original: de la ni chos can rtag pa la'o //
analyzed: de la ni chos can rtag pa la'o //
translated: There, the subject is permanent.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe skyon yod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe skyon yod snyam na /
translated: But when is there a fault?

original: gal te de la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te de la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “ If it is said” and so on.

original: chos can nam mkha' rtag pa la'o //
analyzed: chos can nam mkha' rtag pa la'o //
translated: The subject is permanent space.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni chos mi rtag pa nyid mi 'grub na de'i tshe phyogs la gnod pa'i mtshan nyid 'di skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni chos mi rtag pa nyid mi 'grub na de'i tshe phyogs la gnod pa'i mtshan nyid 'di skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: “ This” refers to impermanence, the property. If it is not established, then at that time this fault, which has the characteristic of refuting the subject, would occur.

original: ci ltar nam mkha' rtag pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar nam mkha' rtag pa yin snyam na /
translated: How is space permanent?

original: cig car sgra sogs rgyu min phyir //
analyzed: cig car sgra sogs rgyu min phyir //
translated: Because sound and so on are not simultaneous causes.

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs rnam par 'grel pas lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs rnam par 'grel pas lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The reply to this is:

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Thus, etc.”

original: dbyangs kyi dbye ba ci ltar srid pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbyangs kyi dbye ba ci ltar srid pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is there a division of the voice?

original: bad ka na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bad ka na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Phlegm, etc.”

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: mgrin pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The space in the throat, etc.”

original: ci ltar @100b mgrin pa'i sbubs kyi nam mkha' nyid ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar @100b mgrin pa'i sbubs kyi nam mkha' nyid ce na /
translated: How is it the space in the throat?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Thus, etc.”

original: de lta na yang ci ltar mi rtag snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci ltar mi rtag snyam na /
translated: Even so, how is it impermanent?

original: de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is not in that condition.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “But, etc.”

original: 'dir ni mgrin pa'i sbubs kyi bdag nyid kyi nam mkhar ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni mgrin pa'i sbubs kyi bdag nyid kyi nam mkhar ro //
translated: Here, it is the space in the throat.

original: dngos po gzhan bad kan la sogs pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan bad kan la sogs pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: The existence of other entities, phlegm, etc.

original: de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po gzhan med pa'i dus na yod pa gang yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni dngos po gzhan med pa'i dus na yod pa gang yin pa nyid do //
translated: “It is just that” means that it is just what exists when the other entities do not exist.

original: lan ni snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni snga ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply is: “The former, etc.”

original: dogs pa ni bad kan la sogs pa'i gegs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dogs pa ni bad kan la sogs pa'i gegs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The doubt is that there is an obstruction of phlegm, etc.

original: lan ni rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rtag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: “eternality.”

original: gal te ci ltar yan lag can yan lag du ma la khyab pa gcig yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' yang dngos po du ma la khyab pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: gal te ci ltar yan lag can yan lag du ma la khyab pa gcig yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' yang dngos po du ma la khyab pa gcig yin no //
translated: Just as the possessor of parts is one and pervades many parts, so too space is one and pervades many things.

original: gal te yang yan lag can la 'bras bu nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid yod pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang yan lag can la 'bras bu nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid yod pa yin la /
translated: Even if the possessor of parts has the qualities of being an effect and being impermanent,

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa dang 'bras bu ma yin pa de lta na yang khyab pa tsam gyis yan lag can dpe nyid yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa dang 'bras bu ma yin pa de lta na yang khyab pa tsam gyis yan lag can dpe nyid yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: and space has the qualities of being permanent and not being an effect, still, because of mere pervasion, the possessor of parts is the example.🔽To anticipate this qualm, the root text states:

original: yan lag can yang med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can yang med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The possessor of parts does not exist at all.

original: ci ltar dpe de la brten nas nam mkha' yang de ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ci ltar dpe de la brten nas nam mkha' yang de ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Just as the example is so too is space.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gal te yan lag can med na de'i tshe yan lag gcig drangs pas thams cad 'ong bar mi 'gyur pa zhig nas 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can med na de'i tshe yan lag gcig drangs pas thams cad 'ong bar mi 'gyur pa zhig nas 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: Moreover, if the possessor of parts does not exist, then when one part is drawn, all do not come.

original: des na yan lag can ni yod pa kho na'o zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na yan lag can ni yod pa kho na'o zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the whole does exist.

original: mgrin pa'i sbubs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mgrin pa'i sbubs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words “throat” and so on is as follows:

original: gcig drangs pas thams cad 'ong ba ni yan lag can dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig drangs pas thams cad 'ong ba ni yan lag can dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: When one is drawn, all come, but they are not related to the whole,

original: yan lag can med kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro //🔽mgrin pa'i sbubs kyis ni lus brtsams pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yan lag can med kyang mthong ba'i phyir ro // mgrin pa'i sbubs kyis ni lus brtsams pa yin mod kyi /
translated: because they are seen even when the whole does not exist.🔽The body is begun with the throat.

original: mgrin pa'i sbubs dangs pa na yang lus 'ong pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i sbubs dangs pa na yang lus 'ong pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: But when the throat is drawn, the body comes.

original: khyod kyis 'dod pas ni mgrin pa'i sbubs dang lus gnyis rigs mi mthun pas na /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'dod pas ni mgrin pa'i sbubs dang lus gnyis rigs mi mthun pas na /
translated: But you maintain that the throat and the body are of different kinds,

original: rtsom par byed pa dang brtsam par bya ba med pas yan lag can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsom par byed pa dang brtsam par bya ba med pas yan lag can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no beginning and no beginning to be begun, and because there is no whole.

original: mgrin pa'i sbubs nas drangs pa na lus logs su lus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgrin pa'i sbubs nas drangs pa na lus logs su lus par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the throat is drawn, the body remains apart.

original: yang na lus drangs pa na mgrin pa'i sbubs ci'i phyir logs su mi 'gyur zhes tshig rkang bsgor la sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na lus drangs pa na mgrin pa'i sbubs ci'i phyir logs su mi 'gyur zhes tshig rkang bsgor la sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, when the body is drawn, why wouldn’t the cavity of the throat be separate?

original: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a transformation,

original: des na gcig drangs pa na thams cad 'ong ba ni yan lag can dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir de las ni yan lag can mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des na gcig drangs pa na thams cad 'ong ba ni yan lag can dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir de las ni yan lag can mi 'grub po //
translated: therefore, when one is drawn, all do not come, because it is not related to the whole, therefore, the whole is not established from that.

original: des na de'i dpes nam @101a * //
analyzed: des na de'i dpes nam @101a * //
translated: Therefore, by that example,

original: mkha' de bzhin du 'grub par ci ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' de bzhin du 'grub par ci ltar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: how could space be established in the same way?

original: des na yan lag can gyi dpe 'di ni gyi na yin te /
analyzed: des na yan lag can gyi dpe 'di ni gyi na yin te /
translated: Therefore, this example of the whole is useless,

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: “Therefore” and so on concludes.

original: gzhan gyi 'dod pa can ni sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'dod pa can ni sangs rgyas pa'i grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “The assertion of others” is the Buddhist philosophical tenet.

original: de'i 'dod pa gang yin zhe na ;
analyzed: de'i 'dod pa gang yin zhe na ;
translated: What is its assertion?

original: / nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Space” and so on.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyang 'di ltar gseng dag rtog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyang 'di ltar gseng dag rtog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //
translated: Impermanence is also taught like this by “conceptions of space” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i 'dod pas nam mkha' mi rtag par 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi dngos po med par yang yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i 'dod pas nam mkha' mi rtag par 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi dngos po med par yang yin no //
translated: It is not only that the sky is asserted to be impermanent by the desire of the Buddhists, but also that it is a non-entity.

original: dngos po med pa yang rtag pas rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang rtag pas rim dang cig car don byed pa 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And a non-entity is permanent, because it is contradictory that it functions successively or instantaneously.

original: yang na mgrin pa'i sbubs kyi bdag nyid kyi nam mkha'i ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes brjod ma thag pa nyid kyi mjug ba sdu ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na mgrin pa'i sbubs kyi bdag nyid kyi nam mkha'i ni mi rtag pa yin no zhes brjod ma thag pa nyid kyi mjug ba sdu ba yin no //
translated: Or else, the sky that has the nature of the cavity of the throat is impermanent, as was just stated.

original: gzhan bye brag ba la sogs pas 'dod pa'i nam mkha' ni yang na dngos po med pa yin no zhes sdar brjod pa mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan bye brag ba la sogs pas 'dod pa'i nam mkha' ni yang na dngos po med pa yin no zhes sdar brjod pa mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The other sky, which is asserted by the Vaiśeṣikas and so on, is a non-entity.

original: 'dis ni snang ba la sogs pa las dpen pa'i rang bzhin dag pa dang yangs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gseng nam mkha' yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni snang ba la sogs pa las dpen pa'i rang bzhin dag pa dang yangs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi gseng nam mkha' yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that space is the nature of clarity and vastness, which is separate from light and so on.

original: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nam mkha' snang ba'i rang bzhin yin par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nam mkha' snang ba'i rang bzhin yin par ston pa yin no //
translated: Or else, by the words “or else” and so on, it teaches that space is the nature of light.

original: ka ba la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang ma 'dres pa de'i bdag nyid du ma gyur pa'i snang ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha' zhes bya bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ka ba la thogs pa dang bcas pa dang ma 'dres pa de'i bdag nyid du ma gyur pa'i snang ba la sogs pa ni nam mkha' zhes bya bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: The appearance of space is said to be that which is not obstructed by a pillar, etc., and is not mixed with the nature of that which is not obstructed by a pillar, etc.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i nam mkha' yang mi rtag pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i nam mkha' yang mi rtag pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement that such space is impermanent is as follows:

original: ka ba la sogs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gzhan dang ma 'brel pa'i don gzhan snang ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi nam mkha' yin no //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gzhan dang ma 'brel pa'i don gzhan snang ba la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi nam mkha' yin no //
translated: That which is the appearance, etc., of a thing that is not obstructed by a pillar, etc., and is not related to another thing is space that is impermanent.

original: gnas pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the position.

original: snang ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di ni rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa ni rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di ni rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: The position that the appearance, etc., is natural space is the correct one,

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis mdo sdebs khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis mdo sdebs khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted in the sutras and is reasonable.

original: phyogs dang po ni ma yin te de las zlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang po ni ma yin te de las zlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first position is not correct, because it is contradicted by the sutras.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement that such space is impermanent is as follows:

original: bstan ma thag pa'i phyogs gnyis po'i nam mkha' chos can ni /
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i phyogs gnyis po'i nam mkha' chos can ni /
translated: The subject is the space that was just mentioned in the two positions.🔽

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis chos kyi khyad par dang ldan par bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis chos kyi khyad par dang ldan par bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The subject, space, is established as possessing the property of impermanence, as was just explained.

original: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par can gyi chos can la gnod pa la phyogs la gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtag pa nyid kyi khyad par can gyi chos can la gnod pa la phyogs la gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The fault of contradicting the property of the subject does not exist in the case of a subject that possesses the property of permanence.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan @101b pa'i chos can la gnod pa skyon ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan @101b pa'i chos can la gnod pa skyon ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that contradicting the subject in this way is not a fault?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is “because of the following reason.”

original: rnam par gcod par bya ba brjod pa ni de dang 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par gcod par bya ba brjod pa ni de dang 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “that which is to be eliminated” refers to “that which is not related to it.”

original: bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid dang ma 'brel ba gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i chos can nam mkha' la gnod kyang skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa nyid dang ma 'brel ba gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i chos can nam mkha' la gnod kyang skyon yod pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to /
translated: The phrase “contradicting the subject that is imagined by others” means that even though space, which is not related to the probandum, impermanence, is contradicted, this does not constitute a fault.

original: chos can 'ba' zhig la gnod pa na nyes pa med pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: chos can 'ba' zhig la gnod pa na nyes pa med pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it that there is no fault in contradicting the subject alone?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is “because of the following reason.”

original: de ltar nyid du zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par can nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyid du zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par can nyid du'o //
translated: Thus refers to the specific probandum of the context.

original: chos can 'ba' zhig ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can 'ba' zhig ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: A mere subject is not the probandum.

original: de'i phyir 'ba' zhig bkag pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ba' zhig bkag pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in negating only that.

original: grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ga las she na /
analyzed: grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ga las she na /
translated: How is it established?

original: ma grub pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: It says the non-established....

original: nye bar mkho pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'i chos can gyis bya ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nye bar mkho pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'i chos can gyis bya ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not needed. The non-established subject does not function.

original: ma grub pa'i chos can gyis ni bsgrub bya 'grub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i chos can gyis ni bsgrub bya 'grub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The non-established subject does not establish the probandum.

original: gang gi phyir grub pa nyid chos can yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir grub pa nyid chos can yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na /
translated: Because the established itself is the subject, by that reason,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi khyad par can nyid du grub pa'i chos can de sgrub par 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi khyad par can nyid du grub pa'i chos can de sgrub par 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: that established subject, which is the specific probandum, is what is to be established.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But not by its own nature, because it is already established.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na chos can 'ba' zhig bkag pa la ni skyon med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na chos can 'ba' zhig bkag pa la ni skyon med do //
translated: Since that is so, there is no fault in the mere negation of the subject.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: “If” indicates a dispute.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rtag pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rtag pas so //
translated: “By which” refers to permanence.

original: de'i ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i gzhi nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i gzhi nyid du'o //
translated: That is, the basis of the probandum that is desired.

original: de'i rang bzhin la ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin la'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin la ni rtag pa'i rang bzhin la'o //
translated: “Its nature” refers to the nature of permanence.

original: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is not” is the response.

original: rtag pa dang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' ni mngon par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Space, which is permanent and the nature of an entity, is not desired.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of “if” and so on is as follows.

original: bsgrub par bya bar sngar med pa'i rang bzhin bskyed par bya ba med pa'am yin pa'am /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bar sngar med pa'i rang bzhin bskyed par bya ba med pa'am yin pa'am /
translated: The nature of the nonexistent is not generated in the probandum.

original: gtan tshigs cig car sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shugs kyis te gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i gnad kas chos can rtag pa'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs cig car sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shugs kyis te gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i gnad kas chos can rtag pa'i rang bzhin la /
translated: The reason is not simultaneous with sound and so on. The definition of non-cause is by implication, because it is not tenable otherwise. The subject is the nature of permanence.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar grub na de'i tshe /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur bar grub na de'i tshe /
translated: If it is established that the nature of things changes,

original: chos can rang bzhin gzhan du grub pa bkag pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: chos can rang bzhin gzhan du grub pa bkag pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: then what is the use of refuting the nature of things?

original: gang gi phyir bdag cag ni dngos po dpyod pa lhur len pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag cag ni dngos po dpyod pa lhur len pa yin no //
translated: For, we are intent on analyzing things.

original: ci'i phyir khyed mi 'gog snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyed mi 'gog snyam na /
translated: Why do you not refute it?

original: dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the nature of things.

original: 'dig las snyam na tshad mas zhes bya ba'o //🔽gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa med par grub kyang nyes pa @102a * //
analyzed: 'dig las snyam na tshad mas zhes bya ba'o // gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa med par grub kyang nyes pa @102a * //
translated: If you think that is not so, then it is because of the validity of the refutation.

original: 'ga' yang med na de'i cha bde ba la sogs pa med par grub pa la yang nyes ba med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: 'ga' yang med na de'i cha bde ba la sogs pa med par grub pa la yang nyes ba med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: If it is established that space and so on do not exist, but there is no fault, then it would follow that there is no fault in establishing that the parts of space and so on do not exist.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this qualm is:

original: brjod pa'i tshul du gal te rtsa rig gis kun brtags pa'i chos can nas mkha' la gnod kyang nyes pa med na de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i tshul du gal te rtsa rig gis kun brtags pa'i chos can nas mkha' la gnod kyang nyes pa med na de'i tshe'o //
translated: If, in the manner of expression, there is no fault in refuting the imaginary object of refutation by a reasoning consciousness, then at that time.

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' ci lta ba de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni dper na nam mkha' ci lta ba de bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as space is, so is the nature of things.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i nus pa gang la yod pa de ltar ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i nus pa gang la yod pa de ltar ma yin pa ste /
translated: Pleasure, etc. do not have the power to be produced by another, and thus

original: rtag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they are not permanent. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: cig car sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dir gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: cig car sgra la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dir gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: Because they are the simultaneous cause of sound, etc. This is the harm.

original: bde ba la sogs pa med par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa med par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it proves that pleasure, etc. do not exist.

original: ci ltar na yod pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i med par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar na yod pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i med par 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How can existing pleasure, etc. become nonexistent?

original: bde ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽sgra la sogs pa gsal ba'i don gtso bo'i yongs su 'gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu ni /
analyzed: bde ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // sgra la sogs pa gsal ba'i don gtso bo'i yongs su 'gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu ni /
translated: Pleasure, etc.🔽The cause of the manifestation of sound, etc. is the transformation of the primary nature.

original: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gtso bo yin par grangs can pa dag 'dod de //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i gtso bo yin par grangs can pa dag 'dod de //
translated: Sāṃkhyas assert that the cause is the primary nature.

original: gtso bo'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa ni gtso bo'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa ni gtso bo'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The so-called primary nature is the essence of pleasure, etc.

original: gtso bo rtag pa gnod na ni bde ba la sogs pa yang gnod par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo rtag pa gnod na ni bde ba la sogs pa yang gnod par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If you refute a permanent principal, then you also refute pleasure, etc.

original: des na bde pa la sogs pa ni med par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la /🔽cig car sgra sogs rgyu min phyir //
analyzed: des na bde pa la sogs pa ni med par 'gyur ro // gal te bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di la / cig car sgra sogs rgyu min phyir //
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc. would not exist.

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs bsgrub bar bya ba med pa nyid la nges pa yin na ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs bsgrub bar bya ba med pa nyid la nges pa yin na ni //
translated: If this application of the reason “because sound, etc. are not simultaneous causes” is ascertained in regard to the probandum,🔽then,

original: rtag pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ltar /
analyzed: rtag pa'i bde ba la sogs pa ltar /
translated: just as permanent pleasure, etc.

original: mi rtag pa'i bde ba la sogs pa yang med par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i bde ba la sogs pa yang med par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: impermanent pleasure, etc. would also be established as nonexistent.

original: 'gal ba gnod par byed pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba zhig na gtan tshigs nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba gnod par byed pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba zhig na gtan tshigs nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: If it were to be a contradictory refutation, then the reason would be ascertained.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs 'di ni lhag ldan te ma nges pa'i khyad par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za bar 'dod ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan tshigs 'di ni lhag ldan te ma nges pa'i khyad par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa la the tshom za bar 'dod ba yin no //
translated: Because this reason is over-pervasive, uncertain, and has the fault of being inconclusive in regard to the discordant side.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyi yod pa las ldog pa la the tshom za bas na'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyi yod pa las ldog pa la the tshom za bas na'o //
translated: Because there is doubt about the opposite of the nature of impermanence.

original: de nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that so?

original: brjod pa rim gyis byed pa cig car rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid gnyis po 'di la 'gal pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa rim gyis byed pa cig car rgyu ma yin pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid gnyis po 'di la 'gal pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction between these two: the gradual performance and the non-simultaneous causality, and impermanence.

original: des na bde ba la sogs pa cig car rgyu ma yin par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na bde ba la sogs pa cig car rgyu ma yin par yang 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc. would not be simultaneous causes,

original: med pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir chos can la gnod par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir chos can la gnod par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: and because they are not non-existent, how could they be harmful to the subject?

original: rim bzhin byed dang zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel @102b pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rim bzhin byed dang zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel @102b pa ni 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of “performing gradually” is “here.”

original: cig car rgyu min phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cig car rgyu min phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Because of not being simultaneous causes”

original: rim ma yin par byed pa bkag pa brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: rim ma yin par byed pa bkag pa brjod pa yin la /
translated: refers to the negation of non-sequential performance.

original: de bkag pas na rim gyis byed pa gang yin pa ni chos can bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis sngar med pa'i nus pa bskyed par bya ba nyid ma yin pa /
analyzed: de bkag pas na rim gyis byed pa gang yin pa ni chos can bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis sngar med pa'i nus pa bskyed par bya ba nyid ma yin pa /
translated: By negating that, whatever is performed gradually is not the production of a previously non-existent potency by another subject, such as pleasure, etc.

original: rtag pa nyid med pa'i bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid med pa'i bdag nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The reason is for the probandum, which is the nature of non-permanence.

original: gal te gtan tshigs 'di ni rtag pa nyid med pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid med pa yang go bar byed pa ma yin nam zhes pa dogs na /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs 'di ni rtag pa nyid med pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid med pa yang go bar byed pa ma yin nam zhes pa dogs na /
translated: If it is asked, Isn't this reason, like non-permanence, also an understander of non-permanence?

original: rim bzhin byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rim bzhin byed pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order is in sequence.

original: des na ni 'gal ba med pas so //
analyzed: des na ni 'gal ba med pas so //
translated: By that is because there is no contradiction.

original: rim gyis byed pa nyid kyis mi rtag par nyid med pa go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis byed pa nyid kyis mi rtag par nyid med pa go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: By the very sequence of action is not an understander of non-permanence.

original: des na ci ltar chos can bde ba la sogs pa la gnod pa yin /
analyzed: des na ci ltar chos can bde ba la sogs pa la gnod pa yin /
translated: Then how is there harm to the subject, such as pleasure, etc.?

original: de lta na yang chos la ci ltar mi gnod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na yang chos la ci ltar mi gnod ce na /
translated: Even so, how is there no harm to the property?

original: de la zhes smos so //
analyzed: de la zhes smos so //
translated: In that case is stated.

original: des na chos can gang la gnod pa na /
analyzed: des na chos can gang la gnod pa na /
translated: By that is when there is harm to any subject.

original: skabs kyi chos kyi gegs su 'gyur ba de la nyes pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du rang gi chos can smras so zhes mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs kyi chos kyi gegs su 'gyur ba de la nyes pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du rang gi chos can smras so zhes mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The occasion is the obstruction of the property. That becomes faulty is taught. The summary is by that.

original: gal te 'di mtshan nyid kyi bstan pa yod dam cig snyam na /
analyzed: gal te 'di mtshan nyid kyi bstan pa yod dam cig snyam na /
translated: If you think that this is a teaching of the definition,

original: bstan pa kho na'o zhas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: bstan pa kho na'o zhas gsungs pa ni /
translated: the statement “it is only a teaching”

original: gang phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is the reason.
