original: gang gi phyir rang gi 'dod pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa de'i phyir gang gis tshe bsgrub par bya ba de'i rten la gnod pa yin na de'i tshe nyes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi 'dod pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes brjod pa de'i phyir gang gis tshe bsgrub par bya ba de'i rten la gnod pa yin na de'i tshe nyes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because it is said that it is to be established by the proponent’s own thesis, therefore, if the basis of that which is to be established is undermined, then at that time there is a fault.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rten ma yin pa 'ba' zhig pa nyid dam /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rten ma yin pa 'ba' zhig pa nyid dam /
translated: But if it is only the basis of the property of the thesis that is undermined,

original: chos gzhan gyi rten la gnod pa de'i tshe ni nyes pa yod pa min te zhes bstan to //
analyzed: chos gzhan gyi rten la gnod pa de'i tshe ni nyes pa yod pa min te zhes bstan to //
translated: or if the basis of another property is undermined, then at that time there is no fault.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'ba' zhig la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, “only with respect to the basis of the property of the thesis.”

original: 'o na ci ltar nyes par 'gyur snyam na des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar nyes par 'gyur snyam na des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Well, how is there a fault? It is said, “because of that.”

original: bstan zin la yin yang log par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du rang gi chos can gyi tshig gis ston pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste bstan zin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan zin la yin yang log par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du rang gi chos can gyi tshig gis ston pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste bstan zin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “because of that” means that because of what has already been explained, the opponent’s objection is not relevant.

original: chos can gzhan nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: chos can gzhan nam mkha'i yon tan nyid la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The phrase “in terms of other subjects” refers to such things as the quality of space.🔽The phrase “in terms of the subject that is accepted” means that the opponent’s objection is not relevant because it is not a property of the subject.🔽The phrase “in terms of the subject that is accepted” means that the opponent’s objection is not relevant because it is not a property of the subject.🔽The phrase “in terms of the subject that is accepted” means that the opponent’s objection is not relevant because it is not a property of the subject.

original: 'dod par 'gyur ba'i tshig gis skabs ma yin pa'i chos la gnod pas gnod ba ma yin no zhes bstan brin  pa yin yang log par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du rang nyid kyi tshig gis ston pa de bzhin du /🔽mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi chos can gzhan la gnod pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa yin yang /
analyzed: 'dod par 'gyur ba'i tshig gis skabs ma yin pa'i chos la gnod pas gnod ba ma yin no zhes bstan brin  pa yin yang log par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du rang nyid kyi tshig gis ston pa de bzhin du / mtshan nyid kyi tshig gi chos can gzhan la gnod pas gnod pa ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa yin yang /
translated: The phrase “because of that” means that because of what has already been explained, the opponent’s objection is not relevant.🔽The phrase “in terms of other subjects” refers to such things as the quality of space.🔽The phrase “in terms of the subject that is accepted” means that the opponent’s objection is not relevant because it is not a property of the subject.🔽The phrase “in terms of the subject that is accepted” means that the opponent’s objection is not relevant because it is not a property of the subject.

original: rang gi chos can gyi tshig gis log par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi chos can gyi tshig gis log par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “in terms of the subject that is accepted” means that the opponent’s objection is not relevant because it is not a property of the subject.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba @103a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba @103a * //
translated: The phrase “because of that” means that because of what has already been explained, the opponent’s objection is not relevant.🔽The phrase “in terms of other subjects” refers to such things as the quality of space.🔽The phrase “in terms of the subject that is accepted” means that the opponent’s objection is not relevant because it is not a

original: ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mkho ba'i chos can la gnod na nyes par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la mkho ba'i chos can la gnod na nyes par 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because it is a fault to harm the subject which is necessary for the probandum.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what the master Dignaga said.

original: ci gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci gsungs she na /
translated: What did he say?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “If” means:🔽

original: de la ni chos can la'o //
analyzed: de la ni chos can la'o //
translated: There, in the subject.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gnod pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise is the harm.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because the reason follows and is reversed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni sgra la ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore is because of the nonestablishment in sound.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni sgra la grub na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni sgra la grub na'o //
translated: Otherwise is if it were established in sound.

original: bzlog par zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid grub pas na khyad par du gyur pa'i don mi rtag pa nyid ma grub par ro //
analyzed: bzlog par zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid grub pas na khyad par du gyur pa'i don mi rtag pa nyid ma grub par ro //
translated: Reversed is the establishment of impermanence, which is the meaning of the qualifier, not the establishment of impermanence.

original: rmongs pa la ni grangs can la'o//
analyzed: rmongs pa la ni grangs can la'o//
translated: Delusion is in the Samkhya.

original: 'on te rtag pa nyid tshad mas grub pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe tshad mas gnod pa'i phyogs ltar snad pa las khyad par rab tu ma grub pa zhes bya ba 'di phyogs ltar snang ba gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te rtag pa nyid tshad mas grub pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe tshad mas gnod pa'i phyogs ltar snad pa las khyad par rab tu ma grub pa zhes bya ba 'di phyogs ltar snang ba gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: But if permanence itself is established by a valid cognition, then at that time, just as the position is harmed by the valid cognition, it is not established as a special position, called “not established as a position.”

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ But if” is the statement.

original: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i dpe nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi zhes bya ba'i dpe nyid kyi'o //
translated: “ That very” is the example.

original: phyogs ltar snang pa gsum pa sun 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs ltar snang pa gsum pa sun 'byin pa ni /
translated: The third refutation of a position that appears to be a position is

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ both.”

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: “ But if” and so on is the dispute.

original: lan ni da ltar na ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: lan ni da ltar na ni zhes bya ba'o // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The response is “now.”🔽Why is that?🔽“ Because” is the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.

original: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed kyi skyo na thams cad kyi phyogs nyid la gnod pa yin yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed kyi skyo na thams cad kyi phyogs nyid la gnod pa yin yang ngo //
translated: “ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement of the reason.

original: de la zhes bya ba phyogs la gnod pa tsam gyis so //🔽ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ci'i phyir snyam na /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba phyogs la gnod pa tsam gyis so //🔽ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di ci'i phyir snyam na /
translated: “ In that case” is the statement of the reason.🔽“ In that case” is the statement

original: sgrub bar byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub bar byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The proof” is the probans.🔽“ In that” is the place.

original: de la zhes bya ba phyogs la gnod pa yin yang ngo //🔽gzhan gyis bsam pas rigs pa yod par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba phyogs la gnod pa yin yang ngo // gzhan gyis bsam pas rigs pa yod par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: “ But” is the objection.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ Or rather” is the doubt.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i skyon ni phyogs kyi skyon ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni skabs so //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i skyon ni phyogs kyi skyon ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni skabs so //
translated: “ The fault of the proof is not the fault of the position” is the topic.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs las tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de'i dus dang rang gi ngo bo der zhugs bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i phyogs las tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de'i dus dang rang gi ngo bo der zhugs bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proof, which is different from the position to be proved, is at that time and in that form.

original: de nyid gang las shen /
analyzed: de nyid gang las shen /
translated: How is that?

original: phyogs ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽'o na nyes pa 'di gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs ni zhes bya ba'o // 'o na nyes pa 'di gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: “ The position” is the topic.

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ But” is the objection.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: “ That” is the reply.

original: mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang sgrub par byed pa la rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang sgrub par byed pa la rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid mtshungs pa'o //
translated: “ Because of the similarity” is the similarity of the non-pervasion of the position and the probans.

original: ci ltar mtshungs she na /
analyzed: ci ltar mtshungs she na /
translated: How is it similar?

original: rjes su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Subsequently” means later.

original: de yang bya ba ni ma 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de yang bya ba ni ma 'brel ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the statement is not related to the probandum.

original: gal te 'brel ba nyid gnyis la brten pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'brel ba nyid gnyis la brten pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t the relation itself based on the two?

original: de ci ltar ma 'brel pa yang de ltar brjod snyam na /
analyzed: de ci ltar ma 'brel pa yang de ltar brjod snyam na /
translated: How can it be unrelated, yet expressed in that way?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang @103b gnyis la ltos nas rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa yang @103b gnyis la ltos nas rnam par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: The absence of pervasion is also posited in dependence on the two.

original: 'di ltar du ba ni du ba med dang rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba ni du ba med dang rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
translated: Thus, smoke is pervaded by the absence of non-smoke,

original: bong bu dang ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no //🔽zhes de yang gnyis la gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bong bu dang ni rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no // zhes de yang gnyis la gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not pervaded by a donkey.🔽So the absence of pervasion is also not based on the two.

original: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba'i ni phyogs dang sgrub bar byed pa dag gi'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba'i ni phyogs dang sgrub bar byed pa dag gi'o //
translated: “Both” refers to the position and the proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa la ltos te ma grub pa ni ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa la ltos te ma grub pa ni ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The statement is not related to the probandum in the proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa la zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa la ltos pa'i ma grub par rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi skyon yin no zhe na /🔽'di la zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //🔽'di ltar de la bdag ni khyab pa yin no //🔽zhes gal te 'ga' zhig khyab pa dang ldan pa'i bdag bsgrub byar byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa la zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa la ltos pa'i ma grub par rang gi ngo bo ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi skyon yin no zhe na / 'di la zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o // 'di ltar de la bdag ni khyab pa yin no // zhes gal te 'ga' zhig khyab pa dang ldan pa'i bdag bsgrub byar byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The phrase in the proof refers to the fact that the non-establishment of the property of the subject, which is characterized by the non-establishment of the probandum in the proof, is a fault of the probandum itself.🔽The phrase in this regard refers to the philosophical tenet.🔽In this way, the self is the pervader.🔽 If someone makes the self, which is the pervader, the probandum, and so on, as was explained earlier.🔽

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang chos phan tshun khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par du byed pa'i dngos por ltos nas gtan tshigs sgrub par byed pa yin na de'i tshe ci ltar phyogs kyi skyon yin te /🔽phyogs yang dag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang chos phan tshun khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par du byed pa'i dngos por ltos nas gtan tshigs sgrub par byed pa yin na de'i tshe ci ltar phyogs kyi skyon yin te /🔽phyogs yang dag pa nyid yin no //

original: des na bdag khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i phyogs nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na bdag khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i phyogs nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the statement “the self is all-pervasive” is a correct thesis,

original: phyogs ltar snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs ltar snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: not a pseudo-thesis.

original: 'on te chos can bdag med pas gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te chos can bdag med pas gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa nyid yin na /
translated: But if the subject, the self, does not exist, then the reason is not established.

original: de lta na 'o na gtan tshigs kyi nyes pa nyid du 'gyur gyi phyogs kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na gtan tshigs kyi nyes pa nyid du 'gyur gyi phyogs kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then it is a fault of the reason, not of the thesis.

original: gal te chos can grub pa kho na la bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa yin na zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te chos can grub pa kho na la bsgrub bya sgrub par byed pa yin na zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is not the case that the thesis is established only when the subject is established,

original: des na grub pa'i chos can dang ldan pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni phyogs yin la /
analyzed: des na grub pa'i chos can dang ldan pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni phyogs yin la /
translated: then the property of the thesis that is possessed by the established subject is the thesis,

original: ma grub pa'i chos can dang ldan pa'i ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i chos can dang ldan pa'i ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: and that which is possessed by the unestablished subject is a pseudo-thesis.

original: des na bdag khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi nyes pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: des na bdag khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi nyes pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the statement “the self is all-pervasive” is only a fault of the thesis,🔽not of the reason.

original: gtan tshigs kyi nyes pa ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni chos can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba zhes pa ni nges pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi nyes pa ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas brjod pa ni chos can zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba zhes pa ni nges pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Having anticipated this doubt, he says, “The subject, etc.” The phrase “it is said” has the nature of a conclusion.

original: grub pa'i chos can kho na la bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel bsgrub po zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: grub pa'i chos can kho na la bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel bsgrub po zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: There is no certainty that the probandum is related only to the established subject.

original: 'on kyang chos ma grub pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos ma grub pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Rather, the unestablished subject is also established as related to the probandum.

original: des na grub pa dang ma grub pa'i chos can la yang bsgrub bya'i chos dang ldan pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na grub pa dang ma grub pa'i chos can la yang bsgrub bya'i chos dang ldan pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the probandum is to be established as having the property of the subject, whether the subject is established or not.

original: ma grub pa'i chos dang chos can gyi tshogs pa yang dag pa'i phyogs yin no zhes bya bar ga la nges she na /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i chos dang chos can gyi tshogs pa yang dag pa'i phyogs yin no zhes bya bar ga la nges she na /
translated: How is it certain that the collection of the unestablished property and subject is the correct position?

original: rang gi ngo bo kho nar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho nar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, “only in its own nature.”

original: bdag khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par @104a * //
analyzed: bdag khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par @104a * //
translated: The pervasion is said to be established.

original: bya ba kho nar bstan pa yin pa des na phyogs nyid yin gyi phyogs ltar snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba kho nar bstan pa yin pa des na phyogs nyid yin gyi phyogs ltar snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is a position, not a pseudo-position.

original: des na ci ltar phyogs ltar snang bar brjod /
analyzed: des na ci ltar phyogs ltar snang bar brjod /
translated: How can it be called a pseudo-position?

original: des na 'di ni gzhan gyis kyang gtan tshigs kyi skyon nyid do zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gzhan gyis kyang gtan tshigs kyi skyon nyid do zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, others should say that this is a fault of the reason.

original: gal te ma grub pa'i chos dang chos can gyi tshogs pa yang bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin na 'on sngar chos can med pas gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: gal te ma grub pa'i chos dang chos can gyi tshogs pa yang bsgrub par bya ba kho na yin na 'on sngar chos can med pas gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ci ltar brjod /
translated: If the collection of the unestablished subject and predicate is only what is to be established, then how can it be said that previously, because the subject does not exist, the reason lacks a basis and is not established?🔽Therefore, when the subject is not established, that is only a pseudo-position.

original: des na gang du chos can ma grub bde ni phyogs ltar snang ba kho na yin no zhes mnos nas gzhan dag dogs par byed pa ni 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na gang du chos can ma grub bde ni phyogs ltar snang ba kho na yin no zhes mnos nas gzhan dag dogs par byed pa ni 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Others suspect that this is the case and say, How is that?

original: gzhi ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pas zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The phrase because the basis is not established is a philosophical tenet.

original: gang gi tshe chos dang chos can gyi tshogs pa ma grub ba de'i tshe gtan tshigs nyid ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos dang chos can gyi tshogs pa ma grub ba de'i tshe gtan tshigs nyid ma grub pa yin te /
translated: When the collection of the property and the subject are not established, then the reason itself is not established.

original: des na 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi nyes pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi nyes pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, this is a fault of the reason itself.

original: phyogs kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a fault of the thesis.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pas na'o //
translated: “Therefore” means “because there is no certainty.”

original: ma grub pa'i chos dang chos can gyi spyi zhes bya ba ni bdag ni khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa'i chos dang chos can gyi spyi zhes bya ba ni bdag ni khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The general property and subject that are not established” means “the pervasion is not established.”

original: des na khyad par rab tu ma grub pa la sogs pa phyogs kyi nyes pa gzhan du ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na khyad par rab tu ma grub pa la sogs pa phyogs kyi nyes pa gzhan du ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the other faults of the thesis, such as the nonestablishment of the distinction, arise?

original: phyogs nyid yin la gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyis skyon chags pa'i phyir phyogs de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs nyid yin la gtan tshigs gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyis skyon chags pa'i phyir phyogs de sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the reason is faulty due to the nonestablishment of the basis of the reason, that thesis is not established.

original: des na grub pa'i chos can gyi khyad par can gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni phyogs yin la /
analyzed: des na grub pa'i chos can gyi khyad par can gyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni phyogs yin la /
translated: Therefore, the property to be established that is qualified by the subject that is established is the thesis.

original: ma grub pa'i chos dang chos can gyi spyi ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i chos dang chos can gyi spyi ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not say that a nonestablished property or subject is a seemingly similar position,

original: ma grub ba'i spyi yang phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub ba'i spyi yang phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a nonestablished universal is also a position.

original: des na khyad par ma grub pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: des na khyad par ma grub pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, nonestablishment of the qualifier, etc.,

original: gtan tshigs kyi skyon nyid yin gyi phyogs kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi skyon nyid yin gyi phyogs kyi ma yin no //
translated: are faults of the reason, not of the position.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'i spyi yang phyogs yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa'i spyi yang phyogs yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means because a nonestablished universal is also a position.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs la mi ltos pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs la mi ltos pas so //
translated: “Therefore” means because it does not depend on the reason.

original: yan lag phyi ma la ltos pa'i skyon yin pa de ni yan lag phyi ma'i de nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yan lag phyi ma la ltos pa'i skyon yin pa de ni yan lag phyi ma'i de nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: The fault of depending on a later part is related to the reality of the later part,

original: phyogs su gyur pa'i yan lag snga ma dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs su gyur pa'i yan lag snga ma dang ni ma yin no //
translated: but not to the earlier part that is the position.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Therefore” means because it has been explained.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni sgra mnyan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dper brjod ba rnam ba bzhis ni /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni sgra mnyan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dper brjod ba rnam ba bzhis ni /
translated: The word “if” is not to be heard, etc.🔽

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo phyin ci log gi gnod pa brjod kyi /
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo phyin ci log gi gnod pa brjod kyi /
translated: The word if is not to be heard, etc. These four examples express the harm of error with respect to the intrinsic reality of the fact.

original: chos can gyi khyad par dang / chos kyi khyad par dang / chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo la gnod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par dang / chos kyi khyad par dang / chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo la gnod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not express harm with respect to the particular of the subject, the particular of the fact, or the intrinsic reality of the subject.

original: chos dang chos can gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi @104b sgra ni gnyis ka dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi khyad par zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyi @104b sgra ni gnyis ka dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word particular in the expression particular of the fact and particular of the subject is to be applied to both.

original: bsgrub byar yan lag gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgrub byar yan lag gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word part in the expression part of the probandum means that which is to be established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med na med pa can no zhes bya ba ni lha dbang blo'i'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med na med pa can no zhes bya ba ni lha dbang blo'i'o //
translated: The word without in the expression without the probandum means that which is to be established.

original: bsgrub bya'i nang du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam bshad mdzad pa'i'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i nang du rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam bshad mdzad pa'i'o //
translated: The word realization in the expression realization of the probandum means the author of the commentary.

original: de skad du yang bsgrub bar bya ba nyid khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du yang bsgrub bar bya ba nyid khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it will be explained that because the probandum itself is not distinguished.

original: dpe 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sgra ni mnyan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dper brjod pas so //
analyzed: dpe 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sgra ni mnyan par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dper brjod pas so //
translated: This very example means the example of sound is not to be heard, and so on.

original: rang gi ngo po dang khyad par thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo po dang khyad par thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All of its own nature and distinctions means

original: chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang de'i khyad par dang chos kyi khyad par dang gnyi ga'i khyad par rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang de'i khyad par dang chos kyi khyad par dang gnyi ga'i khyad par rnams kyi'o //
translated: the own nature of the subject, its distinctions, the distinctions of the property, and the distinctions of both.

original: bsgrub bya nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di bsgrub bya'i yan lag gyur pa'i zhes bya ba rnam par bskal pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di bsgrub bya'i yan lag gyur pa'i zhes bya ba rnam par bskal pa yin no //
translated: This is because there is no distinction in being the probandum. By this he distinguishes it is a part of the probandum.

original: 'o na rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par gnod pa thams cad kyi dper brjod pa bstan par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par gnod pa thams cad kyi dper brjod pa bstan par bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, it would be necessary to teach the example of all the refutations of its own nature and distinctions.

original: de la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la zhes gsungs so //
translated: To that he says, If it is said...

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir yang bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir yang bstan par bya ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: It is also said, It is not to be taught because it is purposeless.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is in that way.

original: yongs su sheg  pa dgos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su sheg  pa dgos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said, The purpose is complete knowledge,

original: dper brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper brjod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The example” is the name of the chapter.

original: de'i chos can zhes bya ba ni gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa'i chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i chos can zhes bya ba ni gang la bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yod pa'i chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: “The property of that” is the three: the nature of the subject, etc., of that which has the property to be established.

original: gal te chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gal te chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with “If it is a property” is as follows.

original: gal te khyad par yin na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par yin na /
translated: If it is a distinction,

original: de na bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de na bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: then it is not to be established,

original: rjes 'gro med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes 'gro med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no pervasion.

original: de ste bsgrub bya yin na /
analyzed: de ste bsgrub bya yin na /
translated: If it is to be established,

original: 'on khyad par ma yin te rjes 'gro yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //🔽de'i chos su zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on khyad par ma yin te rjes 'gro yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o // de'i chos su zhes bya ba ni /
translated: then it is not a distinction, because there is pervasion.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rigs can du'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rigs can du'o //
translated: “The property of that” is the class of the nature of the property to be established.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i lan no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i lan no //
translated: “That” is the response to the objection.

original: smras pa ni gzhan tsam gyi spyi yin pas de la ltos nas khyad par yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ni gzhan tsam gyi spyi yin pas de la ltos nas khyad par yin no //
translated: “The other” is the mere universal. In dependence on that, it is a distinction.

original: rang gi ngo bo la ltos nas ni spyi nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la ltos nas ni spyi nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In dependence on its own nature, it is a universal. This is the meaning.

original: yod pa'i spyi la ba lang nyid khyad par yin yang spyi'i rang bzhin mi nyams pa ni nyams so //
analyzed: yod pa'i spyi la ba lang nyid khyad par yin yang spyi'i rang bzhin mi nyams pa ni nyams so //
translated: Even though the universal of existence is qualified by cowness, the universal nature is not impaired.

original: gal te smras pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te smras pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it just the thesis that is being proved, and not something else?

original: de ci ltar na spyi'i rang bzhin yin yang de la gnod pas phyogs la gnod par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar na spyi'i rang bzhin yin yang de la gnod pas phyogs la gnod par ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be that even though it is the universal nature, the thesis is impaired by the impairment of the subject?

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni de nyid de zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni de nyid de zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The thesis is just that,

original: khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: which has the nature of a qualifier.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni khyad par bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni khyad par bsgrub par bya ba ma yin na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if the thesis were not to be the probandum,

original: 'dis ni chos can dang chos kyi khyad par nyid yin yang bsgrub par bya ba yin @105a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos can dang chos kyi khyad par nyid yin yang bsgrub par bya ba yin @105a * //
translated: then the subject and the predicate would be the probandum.

original: no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gnod pa gsum pa rnams las so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gnod pa gsum pa rnams las so //
translated: In that case, from among the three impairments,

original: phyogs tsam zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khyad par gyi dper brjod pas gzhan nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs tsam zhes bya ba ni chos kyi khyad par gyi dper brjod pas gzhan nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the mere subject is an example of the impairment of the subject, since it illustrates the other.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad ba don dper brjod pa lhag ma gnyis bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad ba don dper brjod pa lhag ma gnyis bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Therefore, the remaining two examples are taught in order to demonstrate the meaning of that.

original: chos kyi khyad par gyi dper brjod pa de nyid gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi khyad par gyi dper brjod pa de nyid gsungs pa ni /
translated: He states the example of the distinction of the quality:

original: ldan don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldan don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The meaning of the word ‘endowed’ is the quality.”

original: yan lag rnams las gzhan pa'i yan lag can yod do zhes gzhan nyid ni chos yin no //
analyzed: yan lag rnams las gzhan pa'i yan lag can yod do zhes gzhan nyid ni chos yin no //
translated: The otherness of the whole from the parts is the quality.

original: de'i khyad par ni bya ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir yon tan lci ba nyid dang / bya ba'i 'og tu 'gro ba'i 'du ba can gyi rgyu yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni bya ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir yon tan lci ba nyid dang / bya ba'i 'og tu 'gro ba'i 'du ba can gyi rgyu yin pa nyid do //
translated: Its distinction is the meaning of the word “endowed,” etc., because it possesses the characteristics of substance, and because it is the cause of the collection of heaviness, etc., and of action, etc.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gal te yan lag rnams las gzhan pa'i yan lag can rnams yod pa tsam bsgrubs na ni de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa la sgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yan lag rnams las gzhan pa'i yan lag can rnams yod pa tsam bsgrubs na ni de'i tshe sangs rgyas pa la sgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: If the mere existence of the whole that is other than the parts is being proven, then the Buddhist would be proving what is already established for him,

original: brtags pa'i yan lag can ni sangs rgyas pas kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i yan lag can ni sangs rgyas pas kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Buddhist also accepts the imputed whole.

original: de'i phyir gzhan tsam ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan tsam ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, mere otherness is not the probandum.

original: 'on kyang gzhan khyad par can bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan khyad par can bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: However, a particular otherness is the probandum.

original: khyad par de yang bstan zin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: khyad par de yang bstan zin pa kho na'o //
translated: And that particularity has already been stated.

original: dbang po dang ldan pa na mthong ba la ston pa'i don yan lag can gzhan no //
analyzed: dbang po dang ldan pa na mthong ba la ston pa'i don yan lag can gzhan no //
translated: The possessor of the sense faculty is different from the one who sees, the one who is the basis of seeing.

original: mthong ba la brten pa'i khyad par yang bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba la brten pa'i khyad par yang bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The particularity based on seeing is also the probandum.

original: de lta ma yin par bsgrubs na nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin par bsgrubs na nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: If it were not so, what would be the fault of proving it?

original: ma mthong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It would be said that it is not seen.

original: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la ltos te ldog pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la ltos te ldog pa brjod pa ni /
translated: In dependence on possessing the characteristics of substance, the exclusion is stated.

original: khyad par can min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said to be not particular.🔽If one wonders, Is there another example that is stated as 'just a part'?

original: gal te gang gis phyogs tsam zhes brjod pa dper brjod pa gzhan yang yod dam ci snyam du dogs pa sel bas brjod pa dang ma brjod pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gal te gang gis phyogs tsam zhes brjod pa dper brjod pa gzhan yang yod dam ci snyam du dogs pa sel bas brjod pa dang ma brjod pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: The statement of the expressed and unexpressed is made to dispel that doubt.

original: dper brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper brjod pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is said to be.

original: dang po chos kyi khyad par bsal ba dper brjod pa ni yin la /
analyzed: dang po chos kyi khyad par bsal ba dper brjod pa ni yin la /
translated: The first is an example of the elimination of a property.

original: gnyis pa ni chos can gyi khyad par sel bas /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chos can gyi khyad par sel bas /
translated: The second is the elimination of a property-possessor.

original: gsum pa ni chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba sa yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba sa yin no //
translated: The third is the elimination of the intrinsic reality of a property-possessor.

original: de la dang po'i don ni 'di yin te /🔽lci ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i gzhan nyid kyis /
analyzed: de la dang po'i don ni 'di yin te / lci ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i gzhan nyid kyis /
translated: The meaning of the first is as follows:

original: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa'i sangs rgyas pas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: yan lag can ni yan lag rnams las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni mu stegs pa'i sangs rgyas pas brjod pa ni /
translated: The Vaisheṣhikas say that the whole is different from the parts because of the difference characterized by heaviness, etc.

original: yan lag can ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag can ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The whole is different from the parts.

original: gal te yan lag can gzhan yin na de'i tshe lji ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi gzhan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can gzhan yin na de'i tshe lji ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par can gyi gzhan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the whole were different, then the difference characterized by heaviness, etc. would be understood,

original: lji ba nyid la sogs pa ni rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lji ba nyid la sogs pa ni rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: but heaviness, etc. are not understood.

original: @105b srang dma' pa'i khyad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @105b srang dma' pa'i khyad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference of the scale’s going down is not apprehended, it is not ascertained.

original: des na chos gzhan nyid kyi khyad par lji ba nyid gang yin pad bsal ba'i phyir yan lag can ni /
analyzed: des na chos gzhan nyid kyi khyad par lji ba nyid gang yin pad bsal ba'i phyir yan lag can ni /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate the distinction of being different from another phenomenon, the opponent says:

original: yan lag rnams las gzhan min te //
analyzed: yan lag rnams las gzhan min te //
translated: The whole is not different from the parts.

original: zhes bya ba phyogs ltar snad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba phyogs ltar snad pa yin no //
translated: This is the position of the opponent.

original: yan lag ni zhes bya pa la /
analyzed: yan lag ni zhes bya pa la /
translated: As for the parts,

original: yan lag ni chos can yin te /
analyzed: yan lag ni chos can yin te /
translated: the parts are the subject.

original: de dag ni yan lag can las gzhan nyid yin no zhes gzhan gyis sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni yan lag can las gzhan nyid yin no zhes gzhan gyis sgrub par byed do //
translated: The opponent proves that they are different from the whole.

original: des na yan lag can don dam pa par 'grub po zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des na yan lag can don dam pa par 'grub po zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the whole is established as ultimately existent.

original: de la sangs rgyas pas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas pas brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to that, the Buddhist says:

original: yan lag rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The parts, etc.

original: yan lag rnams ni yan lag can gyi rdzas la tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni yan lag can gyi rdzas la tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The parts are not different from the substance of the whole.

original: yan lag rnams kho na la yan lag can zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag rnams kho na la yan lag can zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: The parts themselves are designated as the whole.

original: yan lag can ni don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag can ni don dam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The whole is not ultimately existent. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that it would not be direct perception.

original: don ni 'di yin te yan lag rnams ni khyod mngon sum du gyur pa nyid du 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te yan lag rnams ni khyod mngon sum du gyur pa nyid du 'dod pa yin na /
translated: The meaning is this: if you assert that the parts are direct perception,

original: de dag ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would not be direct perception.

original: 'di ltar yan lag can gyi rdzas las yan lag rnams tha dad par dmigs pa nyid du gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar yan lag can gyi rdzas las yan lag rnams tha dad par dmigs pa nyid du gyur na ni /
translated: In this way, if the parts were observed as different from the substance that possesses the parts,

original: yan lag 'di dag mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'thad pa zhig na /
analyzed: yan lag 'di dag mngon sum yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'thad pa zhig na /
translated: then it would be tenable to make the statement, “These parts are direct perception.”

original: tha dad pa na dmigs pa ni med do //
analyzed: tha dad pa na dmigs pa ni med do //
translated: But they are not observed as different.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i phyogs la mngon sum ma yin par thal te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i phyogs la mngon sum ma yin par thal te /
translated: Therefore, it follows that they are not direct perception in the position of being different,

original: tha dad par dmigs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par dmigs pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not observed as different.

original: des na yan lag rnams ni yan lag can las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: des na yan lag rnams ni yan lag can las gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the position that the parts are different from the possessor of the parts is a false position,

original: chos can gyi khyad par mngon sum gyis mtshan nyid bsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par mngon sum gyis mtshan nyid bsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristics of the specific subject are refuted by direct perception.

original: rdzas ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdzas ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to the statement “substance,”

original: de la rdzas ni yod pa yin te zhes yod pas rten bcas pa'i rdzas ni chos can yin no zhes mu stegs pa dag 'dzer to //
analyzed: de la rdzas ni yod pa yin te zhes yod pas rten bcas pa'i rdzas ni chos can yin no zhes mu stegs pa dag 'dzer to //
translated: The non-Buddhist school asserts that substance exists, and that substance that exists is the subject.

original: de la sangs rgya pas brjod pa rdzas ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgya pas brjod pa rdzas ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Buddhist says: Substance does not exist.

original: gal te rdzas yod na de'i tshe yon tan las rdzas khyad par yod dgos na khyad par yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rdzas yod na de'i tshe yon tan las rdzas khyad par yod dgos na khyad par yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If substance exists, then at that time, substance must be distinguished from quality, but it is not distinguished.

original: 'di ltar rdzas dang yon tan dag tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa zhig yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas dang yon tan dag tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa zhig yin /
translated: In this way, substance and quality are either different or not different.

original: tha dad pa'i phyogs la ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyogs la ni /
translated: In the position of being different,

original: rdzas dang yon tan gnyis khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan gnyis khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: substance and quality would not be distinguished.

original: 'di ltar tshig gi don gsum yod par byed pa ni yod pa nyid yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig gi don gsum yod par byed pa ni yod pa nyid yin no zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, the one who asserts that the three terms exist is called an existent.

original: ci ltar rdzas la yod pa nyid gnas pa da bzhin du yon tan la yang yin @106a * //
analyzed: ci ltar rdzas la yod pa nyid gnas pa da bzhin du yon tan la yang yin @106a * //
translated: Just as existence abides in substance, so too it is in quality.

original: no ; / des na yod pas rten bcas par khyad par med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: no ; / des na yod pas rten bcas par khyad par med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, because there is no distinction between existence and substance,

original: yon tan dang rdzas dag khyad par med par 'gyur ro //🔽des na gnyi ga yang rdzas kyi rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: yon tan dang rdzas dag khyad par med par 'gyur ro // des na gnyi ga yang rdzas kyi rang bzhin nam /
translated: and the qualities and the substance would be indistinguishable.

original: yon tan gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, both would be either the nature of substance or the nature of quality.

original: gnyis ba'i phyogs la yang phan tshun rjes su zhugs bas na yon tan gyi rang bzhin dag rdzas kyi rang bzhin kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ba'i phyogs la yang phan tshun rjes su zhugs bas na yon tan gyi rang bzhin dag rdzas kyi rang bzhin kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And in the second case, because they would be mutually dependent, the qualities would be the nature of substance alone.

original: des na rdzas ni yod pa yin te bya ba ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: des na rdzas ni yod pa yin te bya ba ni phyogs ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, substance exists, but action is a mere semblance of a category,

original: chos can rdzas kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can rdzas kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the substance, the substratum, is refuted.

original: phyi ma shos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi ma shos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The last one is the one that is stated in the following

original: rdzas ni yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rdzas ni yod pa ma yin te //
translated: “Substance does not exist.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ” and so on.

original: chos can dang chos kyi zhes bya ba ni go rims ci lta bar ma yin gyi 'on kyang ci ltar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos can dang chos kyi zhes bya ba ni go rims ci lta bar ma yin gyi 'on kyang ci ltar rigs pa yin no //
translated: The substratum and the quality are not in the same order, but rather in whatever order is appropriate.

original: de la dper brjod pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de la dper brjod pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first example.

original: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel rnam par 'grel pa'i sgo nas bar du chod pa'i gzhung gis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba'i rnam 'grel rnam par 'grel pa'i sgo nas bar du chod pa'i gzhung gis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The commentary on the commentary will explain the meaning of the term “substance.”

original: de bas na re zhig dper brjod pa gnyis go rims ci lta ba bzhin rnam par 'grel pa ni /🔽gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na re zhig dper brjod pa gnyis go rims ci lta ba bzhin rnam par 'grel pa ni / gang zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the two examples are commented on in order:🔽“If the parts . . .”

original: gal te yan lag mngon sum du gyur pa rnams yan lag can las gzhan yin na de'i tshe de las tha dad par dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag mngon sum du gyur pa rnams yan lag can las gzhan yin na de'i tshe de las tha dad par dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the manifest parts were different from the whole, then they would be perceived as different from it.

original: tha dad par dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad par dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not perceived as different.

original: des na de ltar mngon sum ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na de ltar mngon sum ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that they are not perceived in that way.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid du'o //
translated: “Just so” means “as different.”

original: de yis zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i ngo bor dmigs par bya bas khyab pa yin na 'dir ni khyab par byed pa med do //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba tha dad pa'i ngo bor dmigs par bya bas khyab pa yin na 'dir ni khyab par byed pa med do //
translated: “By it” means that the object of perception would be a different entity, but here there is no pervasion by the pervader.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'grub snyam na /
translated: If you think, “Why is it not established?”

original: tha dad par zhes smos so //
analyzed: tha dad par zhes smos so //
translated: “As different” is stated.

original: yin na ci 'gal snyam na /
analyzed: yin na ci 'gal snyam na /
translated: If you think, “What is the contradiction?”

original: tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “different” is said.

original: des na pha rol pos ni tha mi dad pa kho nar khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na pha rol pos ni tha mi dad pa kho nar khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the opponent should accept that it is not different.

original: de'i tshe yang yan lag can brtags pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang yan lag can brtags pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even then, the whole would be only imagined,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: gal te yan lag can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa na /
translated: If the parts are different from the nature of the whole,

original: yan lag rnams mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag rnams mngon sum ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: the parts would not be directly perceived.

original: 'o na ci ltar mngon sum nyid du 'gyur zhe na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar mngon sum nyid du 'gyur zhe na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How then would they be directly perceived?

original: mngon sum nyid yin zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid yin zhes bya ba ni yan lag rnams so //
translated: “Directly perceived” refers to the parts.

original: mngon sum nyid ma yin pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ma yin pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement that they are not directly perceived is

original: gang du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “where.”

original: de'i dngos zhes bya ba ni yan lag can las tha mi dad ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i dngos zhes bya ba ni yan lag can las tha mi dad ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: “Its nature” refers to the nature that is not different from the whole.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid do //
translated: “Just like that” refers to direct perception.

original: yan lag mngon sum ma yin na ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa mi 'grub @106b po zhes brjod pa ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag mngon sum ma yin na ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa mi 'grub @106b po zhes brjod pa ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the parts are not directly perceived, then the other’s thesis is not established.

original: dper brjod pa 'di nyid yang rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: dper brjod pa 'di nyid yang rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni /
translated: This example is explained in another way:

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or.🔽🔽

original: sngar ni yan lag rnams mngon sum ma yin par bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni yan lag rnams mngon sum ma yin par bstan pa yin la /
translated: Previously, the parts were shown not to be directly perceived.

original: da ltar ni yan lag can mngon sum ma yin bar ston ba yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ni yan lag can mngon sum ma yin bar ston ba yin no //
translated: Now, the whole is shown not to be directly perceived.

original: de zhes bya ba ni yan lag can no //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni yan lag can no //
translated: “ That” refers to the whole.

original: ci ltar mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it not be directly perceived?

original: gzhan nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were different.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni yan lag rnams so //
translated: “ Those” refers to the parts.

original: ci ltar mngon sum ma yin na gzhan mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur zhen /
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum ma yin na gzhan mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur zhen /
translated: How could it not be directly perceived? The other would not be directly perceived.

original: yan lag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag ces bya ba'o //
translated: “ Parts” refers to the parts of the whole.

original: yan lag dang po zhes bya ba ni rdul gnyis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yan lag dang po zhes bya ba ni rdul gnyis pa bzhin no //
translated: The first part is like the second atom.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya pa ni rdul gnyis pa can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya pa ni rdul gnyis pa can la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other refers to the one with the second atom, and so on.

original: lan 'debs pa ni gcig nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan 'debs pa ni gcig nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is “one only.”

original: des na zhes bya ba ni yan lag can med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni yan lag can med pas na'o //
translated: “ Therefore” means because there is no whole.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pas na'o //
translated: “ Therefore” means because there is no difference.

original: dper brjod pa gnyis pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad nas /
analyzed: dper brjod pa gnyis pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the second example in two parts,

original: gsum pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: gsum pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: he explains the third:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “In the same way.”

original: yon tan dang rdzas gnyis tha dad pa'i phyogs la khyad par med par brjod nas /
analyzed: yon tan dang rdzas gnyis tha dad pa'i phyogs la khyad par med par brjod nas /
translated: Having stated that there is no difference in the position that qualities and substances are different,

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la yang khyad par med par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la yang khyad par med par brjod pa ni /
translated: he states that there is no difference in the position that they are not different:

original: phan tshun spangs pa ma yin na yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pa ma yin na yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Even if they are not mutually exclusive.”

original: rdzas las yon tan tha mi dad na yang ngo //🔽gang las rnam bar dbye ba yod ces bya ba ni rdzas kho na yin la /
analyzed: rdzas las yon tan tha mi dad na yang ngo // gang las rnam bar dbye ba yod ces bya ba ni rdzas kho na yin la /
translated: Even if qualities are not different from substances,

original: 'di ni yon tan kho na yin no zhes tha dad pa gang las yin zhes ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan kho na yin no zhes tha dad pa gang las yin zhes ba'o //
translated: “from what is there a distinction?” That is, from what is there a difference such that one is a substance and the other is a quality?

original: yon tan nyid dang rdzas nyid kyi spyi dag yon tan dang rdzas dag la tha dad pa med pa'am /
analyzed: yon tan nyid dang rdzas nyid kyi spyi dag yon tan dang rdzas dag la tha dad pa med pa'am /
translated: “The universals of quality and substance are not different from qualities and substances.”

original: tha dad pa zhig yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa zhig yin /
translated: They are different.

original: phyogs dang po la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la brjod pa ni /
translated: The first position is stated:

original: rang gi rang bzhin la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The nature of that itself.”

original: yon tan dang rdzas la spyi gnyis rjes su zhugs na yon tan dang rdzas dag nyid du 'gyur gyi spyi gzhan yod par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang rdzas la spyi gnyis rjes su zhugs na yon tan dang rdzas dag nyid du 'gyur gyi spyi gzhan yod par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If two universals are present in a quality and a substance, then they are just qualities and substances, but the existence of another universal does not follow.

original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni /
translated: The second position is stated:

original: yon tan nyid ni gzhan yin na //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan nyid ni gzhan yin na // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “The nature of quality itself is different.”

original: 'ang gi sgras ni rdzas nyid gzhan yin na yang zhes sdud ba'o //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgras ni rdzas nyid gzhan yin na yang zhes sdud ba'o //
translated: The word “also” includes the statement, “The nature of substance itself is different.”

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni yon tan nyid dang / rdzas nyid la yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni yon tan nyid dang / rdzas nyid la yang ngo //
translated: “There” refers to the nature of quality and the nature of substance.

original: yod mod ci nyes snyam na /
analyzed: yod mod ci nyes snyam na /
translated: If you think, “What is wrong with their existence?,”

original: des na zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na zhes smos so //
translated: he says, “In that case . . . ”

original: yod pa dang 'brel pas na'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang 'brel pas na'o //
translated: . . . because they are related to existence.

original: yon tan nyid rdzas las khyad par med pa'i thal pa snga ma gang yin pa de bzlog pa med bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan nyid rdzas las khyad par med pa'i thal pa snga ma gang yin pa de bzlog pa med bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The previous absurd consequence that the nature of quality is not different from substance would not be averted.

original: dper na yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir yon tan rdzas dang khyad par med par brjod pa de bzhin du yon tan nyid kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir na /🔽rdzas @107a * //
analyzed: dper na yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir yon tan rdzas dang khyad par med par brjod pa de bzhin du yon tan nyid kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir na / rdzas @107a * //
translated: For example, because it possesses qualities, a substance is said to be not different from its qualities.🔽In the same way,

original: nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because it possesses substances, a quality would become a substance.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: yod nyid yod na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod nyid yod na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If existence exists,

original: yon tan dang yon tan nyid la yod nyid de /
analyzed: yon tan dang yon tan nyid la yod nyid de /
translated: then existence would exist in qualities and in the nature of qualities.

original: yod ba nyid yod par khas len na /
analyzed: yod ba nyid yod par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that existence exists,

original: thams cad ces bya ba yon tan dang yon tan nyid gnyis rdzas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba yon tan dang yon tan nyid gnyis rdzas su 'gyur ro //
translated: then everything, i.e., both qualities and the nature of qualities, would become substances.

original: nam gyi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: nam gyi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: tha dad dang gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad dang gzhan pa ste /
translated: When they are different or not different.

original: yon tan dang rdzas dag tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang rdzas dag tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la'o //
translated: That is, when qualities and substances are different or not different.

original: de bzhin du spyi dag tha dad pa dang mi dad pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi dag tha dad pa dang mi dad pa la yang ngo //
translated: The same applies to universals.

original: phan tshun spangs bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa la don 'di yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtsod pa la don 'di yin te /
translated: In the debate about mutual exclusion, etc., the point is this: If substances and qualities are not different,

original: rdzas dang yon tan dag tha mi dad pa yin na /
analyzed: rdzas dang yon tan dag tha mi dad pa yin na /
translated: then qualities would not exist in substances.

original: rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa yin gyi tha dad pa la ni rdzas nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rigs pa yin gyi tha dad pa la ni rdzas nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is logical to say that they would not be distinct, but they are distinct because they possess substantial reality.

original: rdzas kyi gsal ba yon tan gyi gsal ba las tha dad bar 'thad kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi gsal ba yon tan gyi gsal ba las tha dad bar 'thad kho na'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is reasonable to say that they are not different, but since they are different, it is quite reasonable that the manifestation of substance is different from the manifestation of quality.

original: grub ba'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: grub ba'i mtha'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning of the conclusion.

original: tha dad pa'i phyogs la lcags kyi thur ma lta bu'i don dag la gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pas ci ltar rdzas dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyogs la lcags kyi thur ma lta bu'i don dag la gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pas ci ltar rdzas dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In the position of difference, since there is no distinction of primary and secondary in the objects like the iron and the needle, how can there be a distinction of substance and something else?

original: rdzas dang cig shos la sogs par rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rdzas dang cig shos la sogs par rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The reason for the distinction of substance and something else is suspected.

original: yon tan nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it is due to the nature of quality and so on.

original: lan ni rdzas dang cig shos nyid dang ldan pas ni rdzas dang cig shos ma yin no //
analyzed: lan ni rdzas dang cig shos nyid dang ldan pas ni rdzas dang cig shos ma yin no //
translated: The answer is: It is not due to having substance and something else.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yon tan gyi gsal bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi gsal bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it is due to the manifestation of quality.

original: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba gsal bar bya ba ma yin na ni yon tan nyid du mi 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba gsal bar bya ba ma yin na ni yon tan nyid du mi 'grub pa'o //
translated: If it were not manifested in some other way, it would not be established as a quality.

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: yon tan nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the nature of quality.

original: yon tan nyid dang rdzas nyid kyi spyi ni /
analyzed: yon tan nyid dang rdzas nyid kyi spyi ni /
translated: The universals of quality and substance

original: rang gi ngo pos phan tshun tha dad par nges nus pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: rang gi ngo pos phan tshun tha dad par nges nus pa ni ma yin te //
translated: cannot be ascertained as mutually distinct by their own natures.

original: pa dog dang rnam pa dang yi ges stong bas na /
analyzed: pa dog dang rnam pa dang yi ges stong bas na /
translated: Because they are empty of form, aspect, and letter,

original: spyi'i rnam pa ni gnyi ga la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa ni gnyi ga la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the universal aspect is the same in both.

original: de'i zhes bya ba yon tan nyid dang rdzas nyid kyi khyad par rdzas nyid dam yon tan nyid kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba yon tan nyid dang rdzas nyid kyi khyad par rdzas nyid dam yon tan nyid kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That which is called “its” is the distinction of quality and substance, the uncommon nature of substance or quality.

original: de dang rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dang rigs mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is called “incompatible with that”

original: rdzas kyi gsal ba dang rigs mi mthun pa yon tan gyi gsal bas gsal bar bya ba nyid ni yon tan nyid kyi khyad par yin ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi gsal ba dang rigs mi mthun pa yon tan gyi gsal bas gsal bar bya ba nyid ni yon tan nyid kyi khyad par yin ba'o //
translated: is the manifestation of quality, which is incompatible with the manifestation of substance. The manifestation by the manifestation of quality, which is incompatible with the substance, is the distinction of quality.

original: rigs mi mthun pa gnas ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rdzas nyid dang rigs mi mthun pa yon tan nyid gnas pas so //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa gnas ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rdzas nyid dang rigs mi mthun pa yon tan nyid gnas pas so //
translated: “Because of the presence of a different type” means because of the presence of a different type of substance, namely, quality.

original: rigs gsal ba rigs mi mthun ba yin na yon tan nyid gsal bar byed la /
analyzed: rigs gsal ba rigs mi mthun ba yin na yon tan nyid gsal bar byed la /
translated: If the manifestation of a type is a different type, then the manifestation of quality manifests.

original: rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyang rdzas nyid dang mi 'dra ba yon tan nyid kyi rigs @107b dang ldan ba las yin na /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa nyid kyang rdzas nyid dang mi 'dra ba yon tan nyid kyi rigs @107b dang ldan ba las yin na /
translated: And if the presence of a different type is due to the possession of the type of quality, which is not the same as the type of substance,

original: des na yon tan nyid dang ldan pas rigs mi mthun ba nyid rigs mi mthun pa nyid yin na yang gsal ba yon tan nyid kyis gsal bar byed ba yin no //
analyzed: des na yon tan nyid dang ldan pas rigs mi mthun ba nyid rigs mi mthun pa nyid yin na yang gsal ba yon tan nyid kyis gsal bar byed ba yin no //
translated: then because of the possession of quality, the presence of a different type is also manifested by quality, even if it is a different type.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni spyi dag la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni spyi dag la'o //
translated: “In that case” refers to universals.

original: rigs mi mthun ba gnas pa nyid ni mi 'bra ba'i rigs dang 'brel ba nyid do //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun ba gnas pa nyid ni mi 'bra ba'i rigs dang 'brel ba nyid do //
translated: “The presence of a different type” means the connection with a different type of non-contact.

original: ldog pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni rigs dag go //
analyzed: ldog pa nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni rigs dag go //
translated: “If it is a mere negation” means if it is a type.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'i ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo'i ldog pa nyid do //
translated: “In that case” means in the case of the negation of its own nature.

original: de'i phyir yon tan nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pas ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pas ni /
translated: Therefore, the universals are not endowed with substance, etc.

original: rdzas dang cig shos nyid la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzas dang cig shos nyid la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: because they are endowed with quality, etc.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'di snyam du rang gi ngo bos ni rigs rnams phan tshun ldog pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'di snyam du rang gi ngo bos ni rigs rnams phan tshun ldog pa ma yin na /
translated: If you think that the universals are not mutually exclusive by way of their own nature,

original: gang gis bsal ba rnams kyang de ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis bsal ba rnams kyang de ltar 'gyur /
translated: then why are the exclusions also not like that?

original: 'on kyang rdzas nyid la sogs pa las yon tan nyid ldog pa ni yon tan zhes bya ba mtshungs pa'i rnam ba can gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rdzas nyid la sogs pa las yon tan nyid ldog pa ni yon tan zhes bya ba mtshungs pa'i rnam ba can gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: However, the exclusion of quality from substance, etc. is the reason for the cognition that has the form of the similarity called quality.

original: de bzhin du rigs rnams phan tshun ldog pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs rnams phan tshun ldog pa yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you think that there is no fault because the universals are mutually exclusive,

original: lan ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the answer is

original: bar ma do'i sha lhag pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa med pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma do'i sha lhag pa zhes bya ba ni dgos pa med pa'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: The excess of intermediate flesh is a state of no purpose.

original: ci ltar dgos pa med snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar dgos pa med snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is purposeless,

original: rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the answer is

original: spyi rang gi dogs pa rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: spyi rang gi dogs pa rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The definition of a universal is that which is the cause of the cognition of a general aspect, which is the opposite of the dissimilar.

original: spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi nges ba gang yin ba de nyid kyis 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi nges ba gang yin ba de nyid kyis 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is established by the very fact that it is the cause of the cognition of a general aspect, which is the opposite of the dissimilar.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa'i spyi dmigs pa ni med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo las tha dad pa'i spyi dmigs pa ni med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no universal that is observed separately from its own nature.

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni spyi med dang ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni spyi med dang ngo //
translated: “If that were the case” means if there were no universal.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rdzas nyid la sogs pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rdzas nyid la sogs pas na'o //
translated: “Therefore” means because of substance and so on.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe khyad par yod snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe khyad par yod snyam na /
translated: If you think there is a difference,

original: med na ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: med na ni zhes smos so //
translated: then it says, “If there were no difference.”

original: khyad par gyi rnam pa nyid brjod pa ni rdzas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par gyi rnam pa nyid brjod pa ni rdzas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The expression “the aspect of difference” is “substance” and so on.

original: gnyi ga'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar te rang gi ngo bo gnyi ga bsal ba dang / gnyi ga'i khyad par bsal ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar te rang gi ngo bo gnyi ga bsal ba dang / gnyi ga'i khyad par bsal ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: The word “both” is applied to each, because the nature of both is excluded and the difference of both is excluded.

original: 'dir ni dper brjod ma thag tu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni dper brjod ma thag tu bstan pa yin te /
translated: Here, the example is taught immediately after the statement.

original: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba dang / chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba dang / chos kyi khyad par bsal ba dang / chos can gyi khyad bar bsal ba dang / chos dang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo'i tshogs ba bsal ba na /
analyzed: chos kyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba dang / chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo bsal ba dang / chos kyi khyad par bsal ba dang / chos can gyi khyad bar bsal ba dang / chos dang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo'i tshogs ba bsal ba na /
translated: The refutation of the intrinsic reality of the property, the refutation of the intrinsic reality of the basis of the property, the refutation of the property’s distinction, the refutation of the distinction of the basis of the property, and the refutation of the collection of the intrinsic realities of the property and the basis of the property.

original: chos dang chos can gyi khyad par gyi tshogs bsel ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi khyad par gyi tshogs bsel ba'o //
