translated: The refutation of the collection of the property and the distinction of the basis of the property.

original: de la chos kyi rang gi ngo bo sel bas ni sgra mnyan bya ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dper brjod pa rnam pa bzhi nye bar bkod pa yin no //🔽lhag ma gsum ni de ma @108a * //
analyzed: de la chos kyi rang gi ngo bo sel bas ni sgra mnyan bya ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa dper brjod pa rnam pa bzhi nye bar bkod pa yin no // lhag ma gsum ni de ma @108a * //
translated: In this regard, the refutation of the intrinsic reality of the property is illustrated by the four examples beginning with “Sound is not audible.”

original: thag tu bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thag tu bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: The remaining three are just as they were explained immediately above.

original: da ni dper brjod pa lhag ma gnyis brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni dper brjod pa lhag ma gnyis brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Now, the two remaining examples should be stated.

original: gal te yang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang / chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang / de dag gi khyad par rnams kyi dper brjod pa bstan zin pa de lta na yang de dag ni tha dad bar dper brjod ba yin la ;
analyzed: gal te yang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dang / chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang / de dag gi khyad par rnams kyi dper brjod pa bstan zin pa de lta na yang de dag ni tha dad bar dper brjod ba yin la ;
translated: Although the examples of the intrinsic reality of phenomena, the intrinsic reality of the subject, and the distinctions of those have already been taught, they are still different examples.

original: da ni dper brjod pa gcig nyid la gnyis gnyis nye bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni dper brjod pa gcig nyid la gnyis gnyis nye bar ston pa yin no //
translated: Now, two of them are shown in a single example.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ngag thams cad ni bden pa'i don can ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ngag thams cad ni bden pa'i don can ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: all speech is not meaningful.

original: ci ltar na 'di gnyi ga ltar yang phyogs kyi nyis ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar na 'di gnyi ga ltar yang phyogs kyi nyis ba yin snyam na /
translated: How is it that both are faults of the thesis?

original: tshig kun zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshig kun zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, “all words.”

original: gang dang bden pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang dang bden pa ma yin pa /
translated: What is not true?

original: chos can dang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dag dang / de'i ngo bo'i khyad bar dag ste /
analyzed: chos can dang chos kyi rang gi ngo bo dag dang / de'i ngo bo'i khyad bar dag ste /
translated: The intrinsic reality of the subject and the object, and the distinctions of their intrinsic reality.

original: ngag dang bden pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo khyad par dag spong ba brjod par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: ngag dang bden pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo khyad par dag spong ba brjod par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If he wishes to state the abandonment of the intrinsic reality of speech and the intrinsic reality of what is not true,

original: gnyi ga'i rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i rang gi ngo bo dang khyad par spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi skyon yin no //
translated: The fault is that both the subject and the predicate are negated.

original: 'di ltar dag ni chos can no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dag ni chos can no //
translated: “ Thus, this is the subject.

original: bden pa min pa nyid ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin no /
analyzed: bden pa min pa nyid ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin no /
translated: “ It is not true” is the predicate.

original: 'di gnyi ga yang sel ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyi ga yang sel ba yin no //
translated: Both of these are negated.

original: gang zhig ngag thams cad ni brdzun yin no zhes brjod pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig ngag thams cad ni brdzun yin no zhes brjod pa de ni /
translated: One who says that all speech is false

original: chos can ngag dang chos mi bden pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba yin te /
analyzed: chos can ngag dang chos mi bden pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo sel ba yin te /
translated: negates the subject, speech, and the nature of the predicate, untruth.

original: dag thams cad mi bden pa nyid kyis dag 'di yang rjod par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dag thams cad mi bden pa nyid kyis dag 'di yang rjod par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: Since all speech is false, this speech also would not be a speaker.

original: rjod par byed pa nyid med na yang mi bden pa nyid du ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa nyid med na yang mi bden pa nyid du ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it is not a speaker, it cannot teach untruth.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid tshad mar ston pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid tshad mar ston pa na /
translated: Therefore, when one teaches that one is an authority,

original: 'di phyogs ltar snang ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di phyogs ltar snang ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: one teaches that one’s position is merely apparent.

original: de ltar chos dang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo sel bas dper brjod bas dper brjod ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar chos dang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo sel bas dper brjod bas dper brjod ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the exemplification of the exclusion of the intrinsic reality of the property and the property-possessor is taught by means of the example.

original: da ni de'i khyad par sel ba'i sgo nas ston pa ni /
analyzed: da ni de'i khyad par sel ba'i sgo nas ston pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to teach the exclusion of its distinction, he says:

original: tshig kun bden pa'i don min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshig kun bden pa'i don min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: All words do not have a real referent.

original: ngag ni chos can no //
analyzed: ngag ni chos can no //
translated: Speech is the property-possessor.

original: de'i khyad par ni rtag ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni rtag ba nyid do //
translated: Its distinction is permanence.

original: bden pa ma yin ba'i spyi ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin la de'i khyad par ni brjod par bya ba ni bden pa can no //
analyzed: bden pa ma yin ba'i spyi ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos yin la de'i khyad par ni brjod par bya ba ni bden pa can no //
translated: The unreal universal is the property to be proven. Its distinction is the expressible, which is real.

original: mi bden pa'i sgra ni brjod bar bya ba dang / brjod bar bya ba ma yin pa la gnas pa'i brdzun pa ci zhig brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i sgra ni brjod bar bya ba dang / brjod bar bya ba ma yin pa la gnas pa'i brdzun pa ci zhig brjod pa yin la /
translated: What is the unreal sound that is based on the expressible and the inexpressible?

original: brjod bar bya ba la ltos pa'i brdzun pa nyid ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: brjod bar bya ba la ltos pa'i brdzun pa nyid ni khyad par yin no //
translated: The unreality that depends on the expressible is the distinction.

original: gang zhig rtag pa'i dag thams cad ni bden ba'i don can ma yin no zhes smra ba de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig rtag pa'i dag thams cad ni bden ba'i don can ma yin no zhes smra ba de ni /
translated: Whoever says that all permanent things do not have a real referent

original: ngag brjod pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: ngag brjod pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: is contradicted by speech.

original: gal te ngag rtag pa yin na de'i tshe rtag @108b pa nyid kyi thams cad kyi tshe gnas pa'i phyir rkan la sogs pa'i byed pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te ngag rtag pa yin na de'i tshe rtag @108b pa nyid kyi thams cad kyi tshe gnas pa'i phyir rkan la sogs pa'i byed pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If speech were permanent, then because of being permanent, it would remain at all times, so what would be the point of the activity of the palate, etc.?

original: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba ni chos can gyi khyad bar mi rtag pa nyid la gnod bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba ni chos can gyi khyad bar mi rtag pa nyid la gnod bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, the thesis of permanence is undermined by the property of the subject, impermanence.

original: brjod ba'o shugs kyis kyang rtag ba nyid la gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod ba'o shugs kyis kyang rtag ba nyid la gnod pa yin te /
translated: Also, the thesis of permanence is undermined by implication.

original: de'i phyir ngag rtag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ngag rtag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the thesis “Speech is permanent”

original: phyogs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: phyogs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: is a pseudo-thesis.

original: dag thams cad bden pa'i don ma yin no zhes brjod pa yang bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos mi bden pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par mi bden pa brjod bar bya ba can nyid la gnod de /
analyzed: dag thams cad bden pa'i don ma yin no zhes brjod pa yang bsgrub bar bya ba'i chos mi bden pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par mi bden pa brjod bar bya ba can nyid la gnod de /
translated: Also, the statement “All speech is not true” undermines the thesis that the property of the subject, the characteristic of being unreal, is the object of expression.

original: ngag thams cad mi bden pa'i don can yin na /
analyzed: ngag thams cad mi bden pa'i don can yin na /
translated: If all speech has the meaning of being unreal,

original: mi bden pa'i brjod par bya ba nyid bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i brjod par bya ba nyid bstan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not taught that the object of expression is unreal.

original: gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba 'dis chos dang chos can dag gi rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba 'dis chos dang chos can dag gi rang bzhin gang dag yin pa de dag bsal ba yin no //
translated: The phrase both of these refers to the natures of the property and the subject.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi khyad par brjod pa ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi khyad par brjod pa ni /
translated: The expression of the distinction of the property to be established is

original: mi bden pa nyid ces bya ba'o //🔽gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid ces bya ba'o // gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the phrase unreality.

original: chos dang chos can dag gis khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag bsal ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag gis khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag bsal ba'o //
translated: The phrase both of these refers to the distinctions of the property and the subject.

original: 'di nyid smras pa ni ngag thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid smras pa ni ngag thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The expression all speech refers to this very [distinction of the property to be established].

original: chos can ngag thams cad kyi khyad par rtag pa gang yin pa de dang bsgrub par bya ba mi bden pa nyid kyi khyad par brjod par bya ba mi bden pa nyid gang yin pa de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can ngag thams cad kyi khyad par rtag pa gang yin pa de dang bsgrub par bya ba mi bden pa nyid kyi khyad par brjod par bya ba mi bden pa nyid gang yin pa de bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of the property to be established, unreality, is to be expressed in order to eliminate the distinction of the subject, all speech, which is permanent.

original: 'di ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: brjod pa'i shugs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i shugs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase the force of expression refers to this.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad mar gyur pa'i phyir brjod pa'i shugs des ngag nyid dang / mi bden pa'i brjod par bya ba can nyid de dag med pa bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tshad mar gyur pa'i phyir brjod pa'i shugs des ngag nyid dang / mi bden pa'i brjod par bya ba can nyid de dag med pa bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the force of the statement that it is a valid means of knowledge, the non-existence of speech and the non-existence of the object of expression are eliminated.

original: gal te chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang / chos kyi khyad par gnyis med na de'i tshe dag brjod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang / chos kyi khyad par gnyis med na de'i tshe dag brjod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of the subject and the distinction of the property are non-existent, then at that time, they would not be expressible.

original: des na brjod pa'i shugs las /
analyzed: des na brjod pa'i shugs las /
translated: Therefore, by the force of the expression,

original: chos dang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang / chos kyi khyad par gnyis dang 'brel ba'i med pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo dang / chos kyi khyad par gnyis dang 'brel ba'i med pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
translated: the non-existence connected with both the nature of the subject and the distinction of the property is eliminated.

original: med pa bsal ba na yang gnyi ga yod par 'gyur na de yang sngar brjod pa'i tshul du bsal zin pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa bsal ba na yang gnyi ga yod par 'gyur na de yang sngar brjod pa'i tshul du bsal zin pa yin no //
translated: Even when non-existence is eliminated, both would exist, but that has already been refuted in the manner stated earlier.

original: chos can gyi khyad par ci ltar sel ce na /🔽chos can gyi khyad par yang zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par ci ltar sel ce na / chos can gyi khyad par yang zhes bya ba'o//
translated: How is the distinction of the subject refuted?🔽The distinction of the subject is also...

original: chos can ngag gi khyad par yang khyad par rtag pa nyid khas blangs pa 'dir /
analyzed: chos can ngag gi khyad par yang khyad par rtag pa nyid khas blangs pa 'dir /
translated: The distinction of the subject, speech, is also the distinction of the property, permanence. This is accepted here.

original: mi rtag ba nyid dang btsal ma thag pa nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yin la des bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag ba nyid dang btsal ma thag pa nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yin la des bsal ba yin no //
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?

original: gal te gang gis te sel bar 'gyur ba de'i mi rtag pa nyid ci ltar zhe na /🔽gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gang gis te sel bar 'gyur ba de'i mi rtag pa nyid ci ltar zhe na / gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?
What is the purpose?

original: ltar dgos pa med snyam na /🔽gal te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ltar dgos pa med snyam na / gal te zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?

original: gsal bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?

original: ngag gi rang bzhin sgrub pa med na zhes bya ba ni ngag gi rang bzhin phan 'dogs bar byed pa ma yin na'o //
analyzed: ngag gi rang bzhin sgrub pa med na zhes bya ba ni ngag gi rang bzhin phan 'dogs bar byed pa ma yin na'o //
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?

original: smra ba po grub pa nye bar 'jog bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: smra ba po grub pa nye bar 'jog bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?

original: phyed snga ma bshad nas phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: phyed snga ma bshad nas phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni /
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?

original: der gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: der gyur pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?🔽If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?

original: ngag gi rang bzhin gyi phan pa med na'o //
analyzed: ngag gi rang bzhin gyi phan pa med na'o //
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it impermanent?🔽What is the purpose?

original: ltos bar bya ba yang yin te zhes bya ba ni ngag gis de ni ngag go //
analyzed: ltos bar bya ba yang yin te zhes bya ba ni ngag gis de ni ngag go //
translated: If it is by that which is excluded, then how is it imper

original: des na zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pas na /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pas na /
translated: Therefore is the conclusion of the proof of impermanence.

original: chos chos can de dag gi khyad par bsal ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: chos chos can de dag gi khyad par bsal ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: The distinctions of those phenomena are the subjects.

original: de ltar dper brjod pa'i spros pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dper brjod pa'i spros pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the elaboration of the example,

original: sngar bkod zin pa'i rnam 'grel nyid 'chad ba ni /
analyzed: sngar bkod zin pa'i rnam 'grel nyid 'chad ba ni /
translated: now the commentary on the Pramii(laviirttikam) itself, which was set forth earlier, will be explained.

original: de la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: With regard to that, that refers to

original: brjod ma thag pa'i dper brjod pa de dag las so //
analyzed: brjod ma thag pa'i dper brjod pa de dag las so //
translated: the just-mentioned example.

original: ci'i don du zhe na phyogs 'dis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na phyogs 'dis zhes gsungs so //
translated: For what purpose? By this position is stated.

original: 'o na ci ltar bsgrub bar bya ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar bsgrub bar bya ba yin snyam na /
translated: Well, how is it to be proven?

original: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: However is stated.

original: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid de yang gang yin snyam na bya ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid de yang gang yin snyam na bya ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the characteristic of substance? Action is stated.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba la brten pa can nyid du yan lag can bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba la brten pa can nyid du yan lag can bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: Similarly, the whole is to be proven to be based on seeing.

original: de ltar mi sgrub ba na grub ba la sgrub pa nyid kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar mi sgrub ba na grub ba la sgrub pa nyid kyi nyes par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: When it is not proven in that way, the fault of proving what is already established arises.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To state that, if is stated.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni yan lag ni zhes bya ba'o //🔽gal te gang gis de ltar brjod par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni yan lag ni zhes bya ba'o // gal te gang gis de ltar brjod par 'gyur ba /
translated: The expression “part” is used here.

original: yan lag can rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa dang / mthong ba'i yul nyid du de smra bas ci ltar 'dod snyam na /
analyzed: yan lag can rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa dang / mthong ba'i yul nyid du de smra bas ci ltar 'dod snyam na /
translated: If the whole is endowed with the characteristics of substance and is the object of sight, why is it not perceived?

original: bltar mi rung ba rdul phra rab rnams la mi srid pa /🔽shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu mthong nas /
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba rdul phra rab rnams la mi srid pa / shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu mthong nas /
translated: It is impossible for the imperceptible atoms to be the cause of the effect, which is perception, etc.

original: 'bras bu de'i rgyu yan lag can 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu de'i rgyu yan lag can 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the effect must have a cause that is a whole, which is endowed with the characteristics of being perceptible, etc.

original: des na de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa kho na bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the whole, which is endowed with the characteristics of being perceptible, etc., is what is to be established.

original: de rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bsgrub bar bya ba yin pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: de rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa bsgrub bar bya ba yin pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the reason that the whole is to be established as being endowed with the characteristics of substance?

original: khyad bar can min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad bar can min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is because it is not a special kind of substance.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni rdul phra rab ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni rdul phra rab ces bya ba'o //
translated: The second half of the verse explains this.

original: de nyid ces bya ba blo'i rnam ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba blo'i rnam ba'o //
translated: The phrase “that very” refers to the cognition.

original: 'on te yan lag can med na blo'i rnam pa de nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te yan lag can med na blo'i rnam pa de nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the whole does not exist, then the form of the cognition would not be that of a whole.

original: des na blo'i rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can ni grub pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na blo'i rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i yan lag can ni grub pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the whole, which is not distinct from the form of the cognition, does exist.

original: ha cang zhes gsungs so //🔽ha cang yul thag ring po na gnas pa ma yin pa phan tshun nye ba nyid du gnas shing ma 'dres pa'i sku yul gang la yod pa sems gcig gi @109b rnam par snang ba'i rtogs pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: ha cang zhes gsungs so // ha cang yul thag ring po na gnas pa ma yin pa phan tshun nye ba nyid du gnas shing ma 'dres pa'i sku yul gang la yod pa sems gcig gi @109b rnam par snang ba'i rtogs pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The response to this is “Too much!”🔽The cognition of an object in which the forms of the parts are not mixed and are not located too far away from one another is said to have the form of a whole.

original: sgra rnams kyi yul ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa ma yin pa ni rtogs pa po la ltos ba yin la /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi yul ha cang thag ring po na gnas pa ma yin pa ni rtogs pa po la ltos ba yin la /
translated: The fact that the objects of the cognition are not located too far away from one another is in relation to the cognizer.

original: phan tshun nye bar gnas pa ni nang phan tshun la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun nye bar gnas pa ni nang phan tshun la ltos pa'o //
translated: The fact that they are not mixed is in relation to one another.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni yan lag can med par 'gyur ba des na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni yan lag can med par 'gyur ba des na'o //
translated: “ Therefore” means because the whole would not exist.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni boms gcig pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni boms gcig pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa tsam gyis so //
translated: “ That much” means the cognition that has the form of a single whole.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni yan lag grub pa med pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni yan lag grub pa med pas na'o //
translated: “Therefore” means because the parts are not established.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that the possession of the characteristics is to be established?

original: de la yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de la yang zhes smos so //
translated: The response is “In that case . . . .”

original: mtshan nyid de yang gang zhe na /🔽yon tan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de yang gang zhe na / yon tan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What are those characteristics?

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang bya ba dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang bya ba dag gi'o //
translated: They are the qualities and actions.

original: de ltar yin dang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin dang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin dang ngo //
translated: “In that case” means if the possession of the characteristics exists.

original: gal te yan lag can 'di la lci ba nyid dang 'og tu 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dang bya ba dag yod par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can 'di la lci ba nyid dang 'og tu 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dang bya ba dag yod par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If this whole, i.e., the scale pan, possesses the qualities and actions of heaviness and downward movement,

original: de'i tshe srang dma' par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe srang dma' par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the scale pan will be lower.

original: des zhes bya ba 'og tu 'gro bas drangs pas na srang mgo dma' par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba 'og tu 'gro bas drangs pas na srang mgo dma' par 'gyur ro //
translated: “By that” means by the downward movement. “The scale pan will be lower” means the scale pan will be lower.

original: bzlog pa brjod pa ni yan lag can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa brjod pa ni yan lag can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opposite is stated in “the whole . . . .”

original: de ni yan lag las lhag ba yang yod ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni yan lag las lhag ba yang yod ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not that the whole is something in excess of the parts.

original: yan lag rnams bcal ba na srang mgo ci tsam dma' ba de tsam ni yan lag can bcal yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag rnams bcal ba na srang mgo ci tsam dma' ba de tsam ni yan lag can bcal yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when the parts are weighed, the scale does not go down that much when the whole is weighed.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dma' ba med pas na yan lag can 'di'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dma' ba med pas na yan lag can 'di'o //
translated: Therefore, because it does not go down, it is the whole.

original: des na ni dma' ba med pas so //
analyzed: des na ni dma' ba med pas so //
translated: Therefore means because it does not go down.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya bas ni yon tan dang bya ba med pas na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya bas ni yon tan dang bya ba med pas na'o //
translated: Because means because there is no quality or action.

original: de med na zhes bya ba yon tan dang las med na'  //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba yon tan dang las med na'  //
translated: If that does not exist means if there is no quality or action.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba 'du ba can gyi rgyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba 'du ba can gyi rgyur ro //
translated: Thus means as the cause of the collection.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid mang  pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'du ba can gyi rgyu nyid mang  pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because means because the cause of the collection is many.

original: 'du ba can gyi rgyu med kyang de mthong ba ma yin pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'du ba can gyi rgyu med kyang de mthong ba ma yin pa ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Even though there is no cause of the collection, why is it not seen?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Because it is not seen by direct perception or inference.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu lci ba nyid la sogs pa dang / ngo bo yan lag rnams las tha dad pa dag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ste 'bras bu lci ba nyid la sogs pa dang / ngo bo yan lag rnams las tha dad pa dag go //
translated: The so-called effect is the effect of heaviness, etc., and the nature of the parts is different from the whole.

original: bltar rung nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang ldan ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: bltar rung nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang ldan ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: The word “also” in the phrase “the visibility, etc.,” indicates that the whole is not only endowed with the characteristics of the effect and the cause.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bltar rung ba nyid do //
translated: The word “that” refers to visibility.

original: cig shos zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: The word “other” refers to the substance.🔽If the substance is not visible, what is the object of the cognition of grossness?

original: 'o na rags ba nyid du dmigs pa ci zhig yin snyam na rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na rags ba nyid du dmigs pa ci zhig yin snyam na rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition of grossness is a cognition of the form of the parts.

original: de las 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽rnam @110a * //
analyzed: de las 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni / rnam @110a * //
translated: The word “exalted” means

original: par shes pa'i rnam pa las blo lhag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: par shes pa'i rnam pa las blo lhag par gyur pa'o //
translated: exalted above the form of the parts.

original: de'i phyir yan lag can ni rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'am /🔽bltar rung ba ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag can ni rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'am / bltar rung ba ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the whole is not endowed with the characteristics of substance,🔽nor is it visible.

original: mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is stated in the words “Therefore, the whole does not exist.”

original: des na gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gnod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the whole is not a real entity.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /
translated: Why?

original: yan lag can gyi mtshan nyid gzhan tsam gang yin pa de las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i khyad par lci ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de la'o //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi mtshan nyid gzhan tsam gang yin pa de las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i khyad par lci ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de la'o //
translated: The difference that is the mere otherness of the characteristic of the whole is in the characteristic of heaviness, etc.

original: ci lta bu'i khyad par can zhig la zhe na /🔽med na mi 'byung ba la ste /
analyzed: ci lta bu'i khyad par can zhig la zhe na / med na mi 'byung ba la ste /
translated: What kind of difference?

original: yan lag can yod pa la mi 'khrul ba la'o //
analyzed: yan lag can yod pa la mi 'khrul ba la'o //
translated: The difference that is the invariable concomitance of the whole.

original: gal te khyad par 'di khas mi len na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par 'di khas mi len na /
translated: If one does not accept this difference,

original: de'i tshe yan lag can kun rdzob tu yod pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe yan lag can kun rdzob tu yod pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then the whole would exist only conventionally.

original: rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary:

original: gzhan gyi khyad par gnod pa yin na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi khyad par gnod pa yin na zhes 'brel to //
translated: If the difference from another is impaired,

original: khyad par gyi gzhan nyid gang la ltos pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par gyi gzhan nyid gang la ltos pa yin zhe na /
translated: In dependence on what would the difference of the difference be?

original: smras pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: smras pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In dependence on what is spoken of.

original: smras ba'i gzhan dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: smras ba'i gzhan dag yin pa ste /
translated: The difference of the difference is in dependence on what is spoken of.

original: yan lag can zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu yod pa tsam /
analyzed: yan lag can zhes bya ba kun rdzob tu yod pa tsam /
translated: The whole, which is merely conventionally existent,

original: de las khyad par du gyur pa gang yin pa lci ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de las khyad par du gyur pa gang yin pa lci ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: is the difference of the characteristic of heaviness, etc.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “endowed with the characteristics of substance”

original: lci ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lci ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means “marked with the characteristics of heaviness, etc.”

original: khyad par de yang yan lag med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis bsgrub bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par de yang yan lag med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis bsgrub bar bya ba yin no //
translated: And this distinction is to be established by the fact that it does not occur without the parts.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if it were not endowed with the characteristics of substance,

original: gzhan tsam ni kun rdzob tu yod pa tsam ni grub pa la sgrub pas bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan tsam ni kun rdzob tu yod pa tsam ni grub pa la sgrub pas bsgrub bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: mere difference, which is established as existing conventionally, is not to be established, because it is already established.

original: de nyid kyi 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is what is meant by “in this way.”

original: yan lag can 'di snang ba tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag can 'di snang ba tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: The whole would be mere appearance.

original: yan lag can med na snang ba nyid 'thad pa dka'o zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag can med na snang ba nyid 'thad pa dka'o zhe na /
translated: If there were no whole, it would be difficult to establish mere appearance.

original: snang btsam nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: snang btsam nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be “mere appearance.”

original: snang ba rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid dper ston pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid dper ston pa ni /
translated: The example of mere appearance, which is not different from consciousness, is

original: rab rib ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab rib ces bya ba'o //
translated: “cataract.”

original: de dag ces bya ba ni sgra dang sha sbrang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni sgra dang sha sbrang la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Those” refers to sound, flies, etc.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni yan lag can gnod par byed pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni yan lag can gnod par byed pa la'o //
translated: “Here” refers to the whole that is harmed.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rigs pa can la sogs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rigs pa can la sogs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: “Others” refers to the distinctions of the Naiyāyikas, etc.

original: 'chad ba ni phra mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad ba ni phra mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Negation” refers to “subtlety,” etc.

original: rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa nas brtsams pa'i rdzas kyi lci ba gang yin pa de dag gis gzhal ba'i tshe dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa nas brtsams pa'i rdzas kyi lci ba gang yin pa de dag gis gzhal ba'i tshe dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: When the weight of a substance is measured, beginning with a second atom, it is apprehended because it is related to that.

original: gal te rdzas so sor des pa 'ba' zhig gzhal na de'i tshe de'i lji ba nye bar mtshon par nus pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te rdzas so sor des pa 'ba' zhig gzhal na de'i tshe de'i lji ba nye bar mtshon par nus pa zhig na /
translated: If the weight of each individual substance were measured alone, then it would be possible to indicate its weight.

original: du ma gzhan bzhin /
analyzed: du ma gzhan bzhin /
translated: But not so, because it is like many others.

original: gcig gis ljid @110b nges par gzung bar mi nus te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis ljid @110b nges par gzung bar mi nus te med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One cannot apprehend weight by one, because it does not exist.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated as follows: “In this way.”

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni ljid can de'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni ljid can de'i'o //
translated: “Its” refers to the heavy one.

original: 'o na de med pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de med pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: “But it does not exist at all.”

original: ma rtogs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Even though not apprehended.”

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lci ba nyid la sogs pa dang 'og tu 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lci ba nyid la sogs pa dang 'og tu 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means because of the absence of heaviness, etc., and downward movement.

original: 'di'i lan ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i lan ni de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to that is: That is not so.

original: gal te lci ba nyid bla lhag par mi rtogs na yan lag can bla lhag pa de ni ga las rtogs /
analyzed: gal te lci ba nyid bla lhag par mi rtogs na yan lag can bla lhag pa de ni ga las rtogs /
translated: If heaviness is not understood as superior, then how is the whole understood as superior?

original: lci ba nyid dang 'og tu 'gro ba nyid med par yang yan lag can rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lci ba nyid dang 'og tu 'gro ba nyid med par yang yan lag can rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even without heaviness and downward movement, the whole would be understood.

original: de rig ces bya ba ni lci ba nyid la sogs pa rig pa'o //
analyzed: de rig ces bya ba ni lci ba nyid la sogs pa rig pa'o //
translated: That is known means that heaviness, etc., is known.

original: de la yan lag can grub pa re ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yan lag can grub pa re ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the establishment of the whole is hoped for.

original: de log na lte lcib nyid la sogs pa rig pa log na ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de log na lte lcib nyid la sogs pa rig pa log na ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If that is reversed, then if the knowledge of heaviness, etc., is reversed, what happens?

original: de zhes bya ba snang ba tsam mo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba snang ba tsam mo //
translated: That is said to be mere appearance.

original: bsgrub bar bya ba ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'i yan lag can ni grub ba la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba ni kun rdzob tu yod pa'i yan lag can ni grub ba la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: The probandum is the establishment of the conventionally existent whole.

original: de skad smra ba de ni rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ldan pa dang cig car ldan pa'i phyag dar gyi yung lo'i di gnyis kyi ljid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad smra ba de ni rdul gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis ldan pa dang cig car ldan pa'i phyag dar gyi yung lo'i di gnyis kyi ljid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who says this is the one who would have to explain the difference in weight of the two dust particles, one with two atoms and so on, either gradually or simultaneously.🔽Why?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of that.

original: gcig la ni yan lag can gyi tshogs mang po yod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la ni yan lag can gyi tshogs mang po yod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la ni de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in one case there is a multitude of wholes, and in the other there is not.

original: 'on te gnyi gal yang yan lag can gcig kho na yin pa des na ljid tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi gal yang yan lag can gcig kho na yin pa des na ljid tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if in both cases there is only one whole, then there would be no difference in weight.

original: da lta na 'on so so dang lhan cig tu bcal ba la ljid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da lta na 'on so so dang lhan cig tu bcal ba la ljid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when weighed separately and together, there would be a difference in weight.

original: rdzas sna tshogs kyi bdag nyid can phyag dar gyi phung po dus gcig tu bcal ba dang / de nyid yang rim mam cig car gyi gong bur byas nas bcal ba ste /
analyzed: rdzas sna tshogs kyi bdag nyid can phyag dar gyi phung po dus gcig tu bcal ba dang / de nyid yang rim mam cig car gyi gong bur byas nas bcal ba ste /
translated: The heap of dust, which has the nature of various substances, is weighed simultaneously, and that very [heap] is weighed again after being made into a lump either gradually or simultaneously.

original: de ltar so so dang lhan cig bcal ba na ljid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar so so dang lhan cig bcal ba na ljid tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when weighed separately and together, there would be a difference in weight.

original: 'dir yang de phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang de phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here also, “therefore” is as before.

original: 'dir yang gnyi ga la yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig kho na yod do zhes ni brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dir yang gnyi ga la yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig kho na yod do zhes ni brjod par mi nus so //
translated: And here also, it cannot be said that there is only one substance, the whole, in both cases.

original: rnam par bshad pa mdzad pas ni 'di la dang gi sgras 'phangs pa'i lan brjod de /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa mdzad pas ni 'di la dang gi sgras 'phangs pa'i lan brjod de /
translated: The commentator, however, gives the answer suggested by the word “or” in the root text.

original: lan 'di ni gsal ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lan 'di ni gsal ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The answer is clear, so it is not analyzed.

original: 'grel pa byed pas ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ljid tha dad pa yod pa de'i phyir zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba ljid tha dad pa yod pa de'i phyir zhes bshad do //
translated: The commentator explains, “because of the difference in weight,” that is, “therefore.”

original: bzlog pa brjod pa ni tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa brjod pa ni tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reversal is stated in “the difference.”

original: ras bal gyi 'dab ma'i dpe yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ras bal gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ras bal gyi 'dab ma'i dpe yang mi 'thad do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ras bal gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example of the cotton-fibre is also untenable.

original: ras bal gyi 'dab ma'i rtogs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni ljid do //
analyzed: ras bal gyi 'dab ma'i rtogs pa yin te zhes bya ba ni ljid do //
translated: The realization of the cotton-fibre is the weight.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ras bal gyi 'dab ma'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni ras bal gyi 'dab ma'o //
translated: “This” refers to the cotton-fibre.

original: @111a * // 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: @111a * // 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: “If” and so on are objections.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: “In that case” is a conclusion.

original: de ltar gyur na ni rdzas phreng gzhal ba zhes gang brjod pa de ma 'brel bar thal te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni rdzas phreng gzhal ba zhes gang brjod pa de ma 'brel bar thal te /
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that the expression “the weight of the collection of parts” would be meaningless,

original: gcig la rdzas kyi phye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la rdzas kyi phye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no division of a substance into parts in the case of a single thing.

original: 'dis ni rang gi tshig dang 'ga' ba med du bcug pa de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa nyid zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi tshig dang 'ga' ba med du bcug pa de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa nyid zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This is saying that even if one were to accept, for the sake of argument, the point being made, the error still remains.

original: tha ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “ In that case” is the final part.

original: yan lag can thams cad zhig nas skyes pa'i tha ma'i yan lag can gyi ljid mi rtogs pa yang mi 'thad de de yod pa'i tha snyad med par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag can thams cad zhig nas skyes pa'i tha ma'i yan lag can gyi ljid mi rtogs pa yang mi 'thad de de yod pa'i tha snyad med par thal ba'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is also untenable that the final whole, which arises after all the parts have disintegrated, does not perceive weight, because it would follow that the convention of its existence would be nonexistent.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni zhig pa'i gnyis pa des brtsams pa'i yan lag can gyi'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni zhig pa'i gnyis pa des brtsams pa'i yan lag can gyi'o //
translated: “ In that case” refers to the second disintegrated state.

original: 'di la srad dma' ba'i khyad par med na /
analyzed: 'di la srad dma' ba'i khyad par med na /
translated: If there is no difference in the slackness of the rope,

original: yan lag can yod pa'i tha snyad mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'di yal bar dor nas /
analyzed: yan lag can yod pa'i tha snyad mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'di yal bar dor nas /
translated: then the error that the convention of the existence of the whole is untenable is not avoided.

original: nyes pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: Another fault is stated:

original: de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then,

original: gal te yan lag can thams cad zhig pa na yan lag gcig skye ba yin pa'i phyir srang dma' ba'i khyad par du mi 'gyur te khyad par du mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te yan lag can thams cad zhig pa na yan lag gcig skye ba yin pa'i phyir srang dma' ba'i khyad par du mi 'gyur te khyad par du mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: since the arising of one part of the scale would be due to the destruction of all parts of the scale, there would be no difference in the depression of the scale.

original: de'i tshe rdul phrang ba rnams kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rdul phrang ba rnams kyang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the line of atoms would be destroyed.

original: yan lag can thams cad 'jig pa na rdul gnyis pa yang bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag can thams cad 'jig pa na rdul gnyis pa yang bsdus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When all the parts are destroyed, the second atom is not included.

original: de yang rdul phra rab gnyis po ma zhig gi bar du 'jig ba ma yin no rdul phra rab rnams kyang 'jig par thal lo //
analyzed: de yang rdul phra rab gnyis po ma zhig gi bar du 'jig ba ma yin no rdul phra rab rnams kyang 'jig par thal lo //
translated: And that is not destroyed as long as the two atoms are not destroyed. It follows that the atoms are also destroyed.

original: de lta na yang rdul phra rab rnams ni rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de lta na yang rdul phra rab rnams ni rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo //
translated: Even so, it contradicts the tenet that the atoms are permanent.

original: rdul phra rab 'jig pa spong ba'i dogs pa bsub ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab 'jig pa spong ba'i dogs pa bsub ni /
translated: In order to refute the objection that the destruction of the atoms is denied, he says:

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you say that the atoms are not destroyed,🔽then the atoms would be permanent.

original: rdol phra rab rnams la yang rnam par dbye ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: rdol phra rab rnams la yang rnam par dbye ba yod do zhe na /
translated: But the atoms have parts.

original: rdul phra rab dag la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The atoms, etc.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: No, is the reply.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni cha shas dang bcas ba kho nar 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni cha shas dang bcas ba kho nar 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The atoms are only tenable as having parts.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lus can dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus can dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The embodied ones, etc.

original: 'dis ni rdul phra rab rnams la rnam par dbye ba med pa'i sgrub byed pa nyid ma grub ste gzhan gyis lus can du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdul phra rab rnams la rnam par dbye ba med pa'i sgrub byed pa nyid ma grub ste gzhan gyis lus can du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the proof of the atoms’ partlessness is not established, because the opponent accepts that they are embodied.

original: gal te de ltan mdo sde ba'i ltar na yang rdul phra rab rnams cha med du mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltan mdo sde ba'i ltar na yang rdul phra rab rnams cha med du mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then even according to the Sautrantikas, the atoms are not established as partless.

original: ma yin te mdo sde pas ni rdul phra rab rnams lus can nyid khas ma blangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te mdo sde pas ni rdul phra rab rnams lus can nyid khas ma blangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: No, because the Sautrantikas do not accept that the atoms are embodied.

original: thams cad so so ba ma yin pa'i rdzas kyi tshad ni lus can yin no zhes gzhan nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad so so ba ma yin pa'i rdzas kyi tshad ni lus can yin no zhes gzhan nyid kyis khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The measure of substance, which is not a collection of all of these, is that which has a body.

original: des na nyes pa 'di ni med do //
analyzed: des na nyes pa 'di ni med do //
translated: Therefore, this fault does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yan lag can thams cad zhig na rdul phra rab 'jig par thal ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yan lag can thams cad zhig na rdul phra rab 'jig par thal ba de'i phyir /
translated: Since in this way, when all wholes are destroyed, it follows that the atoms are destroyed,

original: dum bu'i yan lag can gyi rang @111b bzhin yan lag can ni 'jig pa zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dum bu'i yan lag can gyi rang @111b bzhin yan lag can ni 'jig pa zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
translated: it is not tenable to say that the destruction of the whole is the nature of the whole that has parts.

original: de lta yin dang srang dma' ba'i khyad bar du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa so na 'dug go //
analyzed: de lta yin dang srang dma' ba'i khyad bar du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa so na 'dug go //
translated: If that were so, the fault that the scale would be uneven would still exist.

original: 'on te bya ba ni rdul phra rab zhig na yan lag can thams cad 'jig la des na tha mar gnas pa'i yan lag can gcig kho na skye ba de'i phyir srad ngan 'ba'i khyad bar du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te bya ba ni rdul phra rab zhig na yan lag can thams cad 'jig la des na tha mar gnas pa'i yan lag can gcig kho na skye ba de'i phyir srad ngan 'ba'i khyad bar du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if the action of the atom is destroyed, all wholes are destroyed, and therefore, since only one whole that remains at the end is produced, the scale would not be uneven.

original: lan ni de lta na'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de lta na'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, “If that were so…”

original: ma sha la sogs pa rim gyis bcal ba grangs lngas rim par bcad pa phyis gong bur byas pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: ma sha la sogs pa rim gyis bcal ba grangs lngas rim par bcad pa phyis gong bur byas pa rnams kyi /
translated: The five parts, such as the flesh of the mother, etc., are gradually cut up in order, and then made into a lump.

original: sngar grangs ci 'dra ba de 'dra bar de dang mtshungs pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sngar grangs ci 'dra ba de 'dra bar de dang mtshungs pa mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible that they are the same as they were before, in terms of number.

original: gong bur byas ba'i gnas skabs na yan lag can gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / ma sha la sogs pa'i yan lag can rnams kyang zhig ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong bur byas ba'i gnas skabs na yan lag can gcig yin pa'i phyir dang / ma sha la sogs pa'i yan lag can rnams kyang zhig ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of being made into a lump, there is only one whole, and the wholes, such as the flesh of the mother, etc., have been destroyed.

original: 'chad pa ni ma sha'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa ni ma sha'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Cut up” means the flesh of the mother, etc.

original: 'o na ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “But how?”

original: gser zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gser zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Gold.”

original: 'on te lci ba nyid gcig yin yang zhes bya ba ni yan lag can no //
analyzed: 'on te lci ba nyid gcig yin yang zhes bya ba ni yan lag can no //
translated: “Even though heaviness is one” means the whole.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In that way”

original: ma sha lnga'i gong bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma sha lnga'i gong bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: means “the lump of the five parts, such as the flesh of the mother, etc.”

original: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid kyis de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin na zhes bya ba ni gcig nyid kyis de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin na'o //
translated: “In that case” means “if one makes that convention in that way with oneness.”

original: don dam par ni mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang brtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang brtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: “In reality it would not be so,” but rather it would be imagined.

original: de ltar yang gzhan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang gzhan pa ma yin no //
translated: “In that way it is not different.”

original: de'i phyir rang gi gzhung dang 'gal bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi gzhung dang 'gal bas /
translated: Therefore, because it contradicts your own scriptures,

original: rdul phra rab ni 'jig par ni khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni 'jig par ni khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: it is not to be accepted that the atom is destroyed.

original: 'o na ci ltar grangs don dam pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar grangs don dam pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: But how is the number not ultimate?

original: de'i phyir yan lag rnams ma zhig na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag rnams ma zhig na /
translated: Therefore, it is said that as long as the parts are not destroyed,

original: ma sha la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan de la brten ba'i grangs 'thad pa yin no zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma sha la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan de la brten ba'i grangs 'thad pa yin no zhes smos so //
translated: the number based on them is tenable, like the number of the fingers and so on.

original: de la brten pa ni yan lag la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten pa ni yan lag la brten pa'o //
translated: Based on them means based on the parts.

original: grangs ni lnga'o //
analyzed: grangs ni lnga'o //
translated: The number is ten.

original: cig car ldan pa dang rim gyis ldan pa dag ni gnod mi za bar ljid khyad par yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car ldan pa dang rim gyis ldan pa dag ni gnod mi za bar ljid khyad par yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Simultaneous and successive possession would necessarily have different weights.

original: yod pa yang ma yin te des na yan lag can ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin te des na yan lag can ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: But that is not so, and therefore the possessor of parts does not exist.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi'o //
translated: But if, on the other hand means the opponent’s position.

original: gong rol gyi gong ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gong rol gyi gong ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The higher the higher means

original: yan lag can gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: the result characterized by the possessor of parts.

original: ci ltar rdzas gcig mi rtogs ba de bzhin du gong ma gong ma'i 'bras bu thams cad kyang yin par 'gyur te /🔽khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'di la re zhig rang nyid lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: ci ltar rdzas gcig mi rtogs ba de bzhin du gong ma gong ma'i 'bras bu thams cad kyang yin par 'gyur te / khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'di la re zhig rang nyid lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Just as one substance is not cognized, so too all the higher effects would be, because there would be no difference.🔽The reply to this is:

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is not so.

original: 'dir bar gyi sgra bya rog gi lta stangs kyi tshul gyis gnyi ga yang sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir bar gyi sgra bya rog gi lta stangs kyi tshul gyis gnyi ga yang sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: Here the middle term is to be supplied in the manner of a crow’s wing, so that both terms are connected.

original: des na 'di ltar sbyar ste /🔽yungs kar nas brtsams te yungs kar mtha' mtshams nas bzung ste tshogs chen po nas tshogs chen po'i mthar thug par 'bras @112a * //🔽bu'i phreng ba'i gong nas gong du 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i lci ba nyid gal te rtogs pa na yin na /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar sbyar ste / yungs kar nas brtsams te yungs kar mtha' mtshams nas bzung ste tshogs chen po nas tshogs chen po'i mthar thug par 'bras @112a * // bu'i phreng ba'i gong nas gong du 'phel ba dang ldan pa'i lci ba nyid gal te rtogs pa na yin na /
translated: So the passage is to be construed as follows:🔽If the weight of the mustard seed, beginning from the first mustard seed up to the final mustard seed, and so on, up to the weight of the final great collection of mustard seeds, is cognized,

original: de'i tshe yungs kar bar gyi zhes bya ba yungs kar mu mtshams su bzung ba'i snga ma'i lcid dag kyang /
analyzed: de'i tshe yungs kar bar gyi zhes bya ba yungs kar mu mtshams su bzung ba'i snga ma'i lcid dag kyang /
translated: then the weight of the previous mustard seeds, which are held to be in between the first and final mustard seeds,

original: shin tu chung ba je chung je chung song ba ni shin tu rtogs par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu chung ba je chung je chung song ba ni shin tu rtogs par dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The very small becomes more and more difficult to comprehend as it becomes smaller and smaller.

original: des na 'bras bu'i phreng ba de'i rgyu'i rdul phra rab dag nyid gzhal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i phreng ba de'i rgyu'i rdul phra rab dag nyid gzhal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the atoms that are the cause of that garland of effects are measured.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The effects are measured.

original: de'i rgyu du ma bu'i yan lag gi yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu du ma bu'i yan lag gi yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of that is the cause of the parts.

original: de yang zhes bya ba rgyu'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba rgyu'i yan lag go //
translated: That is the cause.

original: de'i rgyu'i zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rgyu'i'o //🔽de'i yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rgyu'i'o // de'i yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cause of that is the cause of the sound.🔽The cause of that is the cause of the parts.🔽The cause of that is the cause of the sound.

original: dum bu'i rgyu yang gzhal bas na de'i rgyu'i zhes bya ba dum bu'i sgra'i rgyu'i ljid yin pa'i phyir zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: dum bu'i rgyu yang gzhal bas na de'i rgyu'i zhes bya ba dum bu'i sgra'i rgyu'i ljid yin pa'i phyir zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, the cause of that is the weight of the sound of the parts.

original: rdul phra rab kyi rgyu yang ci'i phyir gzhal bar ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rgyu yang ci'i phyir gzhal bar ma yin snyam na /
translated: Why are the causes of the atoms not measured?

original: de dag la ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are not.

original: rdul phra rab dag ni brtsam bar bya ba ma yin te rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag ni brtsam bar bya ba ma yin te rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The atoms are not to be commenced because they have no cause.

original: 'bras bu nyid yin na ni yan lag can gyi rang bzhin du rang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid yin na ni yan lag can gyi rang bzhin du rang 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were the effect, it would be the nature of the whole.

original: de'i phyir ljid ni cha med pa'i rang bzhin rdul phra rab nyid la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ljid ni cha med pa'i rang bzhin rdul phra rab nyid la yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, weight exists in the atoms, which are partless by nature.

original: des na yan lag can gyi ljid ni yod pa ma yin pas yan lag can rtogs pa ni log pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na yan lag can gyi ljid ni yod pa ma yin pas yan lag can rtogs pa ni log pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, since the weight of the whole does not exist, the cognition of the whole is simply false.

original: tha ma yis bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha ma yis bya ba ni /
translated: The function of the final part:

original: tha ma'i yan lag can zhig kyang zhes yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du bya ste /
analyzed: tha ma'i yan lag can zhig kyang zhes yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du bya ste /
translated: The word “also” in the phrase “the final part also” should be understood as having a different referent.

original: tha ma'i yan lag can zhig kyang lji ba nyid dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi yin te /
analyzed: tha ma'i yan lag can zhig kyang lji ba nyid dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi yin te /
translated: The weight that is observed in the final part also belongs to the parts of the whole,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dum bu'i yan lag can dang / de'i yan lag dag la mthong ngo zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dum bu'i yan lag can dang / de'i yan lag dag la mthong ngo zhes 'brel to //
translated: which are the cause and effect of the weight.

original: yan lag can yang zhig par gyur kyang dum bu'i yan lag can dang de'i yan lag lus dag la yang ljid de nyid mthong ngo zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: yan lag can yang zhig par gyur kyang dum bu'i yan lag can dang de'i yan lag lus dag la yang ljid de nyid mthong ngo zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Even when the whole is destroyed, the weight is still observed in the parts of the whole and in the parts of the body.

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan du bshad de /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan du bshad de /
translated: Or else, it is explained in another way:

original: tha ma'i yan lag can zhes bya brgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa tha ma'i yan lag can dang / dum bu'i yan lag can zhig pa de dag gnyis kyi lci ba nyid gang yin pa bde 'ba' zhig mthong la /
analyzed: tha ma'i yan lag can zhes bya brgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa tha ma'i yan lag can dang / dum bu'i yan lag can zhig pa de dag gnyis kyi lci ba nyid gang yin pa bde 'ba' zhig mthong la /
translated: The heaviness of the whole and the heaviness of the parts are seen only in the case of the whole and the parts that are cause and effect, and that are destroyed.

original: yang dum bu'i yan lag can dang de'i yan lag dag zhig par gyur kyang /
analyzed: yang dum bu'i yan lag can dang de'i yan lag dag zhig par gyur kyang /
translated: And also, the heaviness of the whole and the heaviness of its parts are seen only in the case of the whole and its parts that are destroyed.🔽But the heaviness that is related to the whole and its parts that are cause and effect and that are not destroyed is not seen.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dum bu'i yan lag can dang de'i yan lag gnyis pa zhig par gyur pa dag dang 'brel pa'i ljid nyid gang yin pa de nyid mthong ngo gang gis phyir de ltar lci ba nyid mthong ba des na'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa dum bu'i yan lag can dang de'i yan lag gnyis pa zhig par gyur pa dag dang 'brel pa'i ljid nyid gang yin pa de nyid mthong ngo gang gis phyir de ltar lci ba nyid mthong ba des na'o //
translated: Because the heaviness that is seen in that way is the heaviness of the whole and the heaviness of its parts that are destroyed.

original: dngos bo'i chos gang zhig thams cad sdud par byed pa dag las gcig la mi srid pa de ni nges par gzhan la yod pa yin te dper na rtag pa dang gzhan dag la don bya ba byed pa nyid @112b bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos bo'i chos gang zhig thams cad sdud par byed pa dag las gcig la mi srid pa de ni nges par gzhan la yod pa yin te dper na rtag pa dang gzhan dag la don bya ba byed pa nyid @112b bzhin no //
translated: Whatever property of an entity is impossible in one of the things that include all, it must exist in the other, like permanence and the performance of a function.

original: lci ba nyid ces bya ba dngos po'i chos kyang rdul phra rab dang rags pa gnyis las rags pa la mi srid pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lci ba nyid ces bya ba dngos po'i chos kyang rdul phra rab dang rags pa gnyis las rags pa la mi srid pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The property of an entity called “weight” is impossible for a gross object composed of subtle particles.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni /
translated: Another refutation is stated:

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover,

original: 'dab bal gyi zhes bya ba ni gcig la'o //
analyzed: 'dab bal gyi zhes bya ba ni gcig la'o //
translated: in the case of a single thing,

original: yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni med pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni med pa yin pa ste /
translated: weight is not possible.🔽Weight is not possible for a single thing.

original: 'dab ba la de bltar rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dab ba la de bltar rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Weight is not possible for a single thing because it is observed in many things.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mthong ba'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the effect that is seen.

original: don ni yan lag can no //
analyzed: don ni yan lag can no //
translated: The object is the whole.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni yan lag can gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni yan lag can gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of that is the effect of the whole.

original: 'o na de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: de rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽ljid nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na / ljid nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: then how could it be understood?🔽Weight is not possible for a single thing.

original: ma shal sogs pa rim gyis bgrangs pa ni phyis bsgongs pa'i yan lag can yan lag can rnams las lhag pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma shal sogs pa rim gyis bgrangs pa ni phyis bsgongs pa'i yan lag can yan lag can rnams las lhag pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The whole that is later imagined is not greater than the parts.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lci ba nyid rtogs pa med pa bzhin du /
analyzed: lci ba nyid rtogs pa med pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the heaviness is not cognized,

original: yan lag can de'i yon tan gzugs la sogs pa thams cad rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag can de'i yon tan gzugs la sogs pa thams cad rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: so too all the qualities of the whole, such as color, are not cognized.

original: gal te de lta na yan lag can la gnod par byed pa du ma yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yan lag can la gnod par byed pa du ma yod pa yin no //
translated: If that is so, then there are many faults in the whole.

original: 'o na ci ltar srang dma' ba'i byad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar srang dma' ba'i byad par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig brjod ce na /
translated: Well then, why is it said that “because the low position of the scale is not apprehended”?

original: rtsa ba'i slob dpon gyis gsungs pa'i dma' ba med pa gang yin pa de ni yan lag can la gnod par byed pa gzhan gyi nye bar mtshon byed yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i slob dpon gyis gsungs pa'i dma' ba med pa gang yin pa de ni yan lag can la gnod par byed pa gzhan gyi nye bar mtshon byed yin no //
translated: The absence of low position that is stated by the root text is an illustration of another fault in the whole.

original: gal te yan lag can gyi yon tan thams cad rtogs ba med pa nyid gang las she na /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can gyi yon tan thams cad rtogs ba med pa nyid gang las she na /
translated: If all the qualities of the whole are not cognized, then what is the reason for that?

original: gzugs sogs zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs zhes gsungs te /
translated: The root text states, “because of form and so on.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i lhag dang lhag ci lta ba bzhin rang gi dbang bos mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i lhag dang lhag ci lta ba bzhin rang gi dbang bos mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the excess of form and so on is not seen by its own sense faculty.

original: yan lag can nam de'i 'bras bu mngon sum nyid ma yin mod /
analyzed: yan lag can nam de'i 'bras bu mngon sum nyid ma yin mod /
translated: The whole and its effect are not directly perceptible.

original: de lta na yang de ni yod do zhes dogs na /
analyzed: de lta na yang de ni yod do zhes dogs na /
translated: If you think that it does exist,

original: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is not perceived by direct perception.

original: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni yan lag can gyi gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni yan lag can gyi gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: And also, others, i.e., the wholes, are not perceived.

original: yan lag can gyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa thams cad mi rtogs pa yin no zhes gang las shes bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa thams cad mi rtogs pa yin no zhes gang las shes bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: From what is it known that all wholes, such as form, sound, etc., are not perceived?

original: 'di las zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'di las zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: From this, i.e., from the tenets.

original: ci ltar lhag ba mi rtogs snyam na /🔽yan lag can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci ltar lhag ba mi rtogs snyam na / yan lag can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How is it that the whole is not perceived?🔽The whole is not perceived because it does not exist.

original: re zhig yan lag can ni srid pa ma yin pas gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i khyad par mi rtogs mod kyi /
analyzed: re zhig yan lag can ni srid pa ma yin pas gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i khyad par mi rtogs mod kyi /
translated: The whole does not exist, and therefore the distinctions of form, taste, etc., are not perceived.

original: yan lag can yod par khas blangs kyang /
analyzed: yan lag can yod par khas blangs kyang /
translated: Even if one accepts that the whole exists,

original: tha ma'i yan lag can la gnas pa'i gzugs dang rol sogs pa yan lag can la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag las khyad par du gyur pa ni rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: tha ma'i yan lag can la gnas pa'i gzugs dang rol sogs pa yan lag can la gnas pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag las khyad par du gyur pa ni rtogs pa med do //
translated: the form, taste, etc., which reside in the final whole are not distinguished from the form, etc., which reside in the wholes.

original: yon tan dang las dang ldan pa bltar rung ba'i yan lag can med pa nyid ces bya ba'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang las dang ldan pa bltar rung ba'i yan lag can med pa nyid ces bya ba'i skabs kyi mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The non-existence of the possessor of parts, which is endowed with the qualities and actions, and which is suitable to be seen is the conclusion of the section.

original: rtsa ba'i skabs nyid mjug sdud pa'i phyir chos kyi khyad bar zhes bya ba'o //🔽yan lag can @113a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i skabs nyid mjug sdud pa'i phyir chos kyi khyad bar zhes bya ba'o // yan lag can @113a * //
translated: In order to conclude the main point, it says the distinction of qualities.🔽The possessor of parts is different from the parts.

original: ni yan lag rnams las gzhan yin te zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi skyon gang yin pa de ni chos kyi khyad par la gnod pa gang yin pa de'i sgo nas phyogs kyi skyon gcig yin no //
analyzed: ni yan lag rnams las gzhan yin te zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyi skyon gang yin pa de ni chos kyi khyad par la gnod pa gang yin pa de'i sgo nas phyogs kyi skyon gcig yin no //
translated: Whatever fault there is in this position is one fault of the position, in terms of the harm to the distinction of qualities.

original: gal te phyogs ltar snang ba 'di gang gi nang du bsdu zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs ltar snang ba 'di gang gi nang du bsdu zhes dogs na /
translated: If one wonders into which category this apparent position falls,

original: phyogs 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is this position.

original: chos kyi khyad par gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyogs ltar snang ba 'di yang gnod pa rnam pa bzhi'i nang du 'du'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khyad par gnod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyogs ltar snang ba 'di yang gnod pa rnam pa bzhi'i nang du 'du'o //
translated: This apparent position, which has the characteristic of harming the distinction of qualities, is included within the four types of harm.

original: de la yan lag can gzhan khas blangs nas khyad par lci ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rigs pa'i stobs kyis mi 'dod pa des na gzhan nyid du khas blangs pa ni /
analyzed: de la yan lag can gzhan khas blangs nas khyad par lci ba nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rigs pa'i stobs kyis mi 'dod pa des na gzhan nyid du khas blangs pa ni /
translated: Since you accept that the parts are different, and you do not accept that the characteristics of heaviness and so on are different, you accept that they are different.

original: gzhan nyid kyi khyad par med par khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi khyad par med par khas blangs pas gnod pa yin no //
translated: But this is undermined by the fact that you accept that they are not different.

original: dper na bde ba ma yin rab tu ster ba nyid chos yod par khas blangs pas gnod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bde ba ma yin rab tu ster ba nyid chos yod par khas blangs pas gnod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is undermined by the fact that you accept that it is a phenomenon that bestows what is not happiness.

original: de bzhin du rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba ni /
translated: In the same way, there is a contradiction with your own words.

original: gzhan nyid khas len bas kun rdzob tu yod pa las gzhan nyid du phas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nyid khas len bas kun rdzob tu yod pa las gzhan nyid du phas blangs pa yin te /
translated: You accept that the parts are different, and you accept that they exist conventionally.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if they were not different, it would not be tenable that they are different.

original: des na yan lag can don dam par yod pa ni /
analyzed: des na yan lag can don dam par yod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the existence of the whole ultimately

original: don dam par yod pa ma yin pa kun rdzob tu yod par gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ma yin pa kun rdzob tu yod par gnod pa yin no //
translated: is undermined by the fact that it exists conventionally, but does not exist ultimately.

original: de bzhin du yan lag can rnams las gzhan nyid ni mngon sum gyis bsal ba yin pa'i phyir na /
